0.title: Period films harder, the world needs to be believable: Ranbir on 'Shamshera'
0.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor stated in an interview that period films like 'Shamshera' are harder because the world it is set in needs to be believable. "Audience...need to know the place and time, they can't be alienated from that. So it's quite tricky," he added. The actor further said that if the story is engaging and entertaining, that's what matters.

1.title: Poor being maligned with talk of 'revadi culture': Priyanka Gandhi
1.article_body: Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi on Monday criticised PM Narendra Modi, saying that the poor and middle class were being maligned with the talk of "revadi culture", while others were earning indiscriminately. "Earlier, petrol-diesel, cooking gas were made expensive. Today, flour, cereals, and curd have also become expensive," Gandhi said. Electricity will also get expensive soon, she added.

2.title: Pleasing to see them dominate on English soil: Laxman on India's 2-1 ODIs win
2.article_body: After India's 2-1 win in the three-match ODI series against England, VVS Laxman said it is very pleasing to see India dominate on English soil. "A fantastic chase to win the ODI series...partnership between Rishabh Pant and Hardik Pandya was a phenomenal comeback," he added. Sachin Tendulkar said, "Congratulations to Team India...keep up the good work and continue this form."

3.title: Fitness certificate of bus that fell into river in MP was to expire soon
3.article_body: The Maharashtra road transport bus that fell into the Narmada river in Madhya Pradesh's Dhar district on Monday was over 10 years old and its fitness certificate was to expire in about 10 days, RTO officials said. At least 12 passengers were killed in the accident. The bus was on its way to Jalgaon district in Maharashtra.

4.title: Hoax bomb threat sent to B'luru school owned by DK Shivakumar
4.article_body: Bengaluru's National Hill View Public School, owned by Congress leader DK Shivakumar, on Monday received a bomb threat that turned out to be a hoax upon a thorough police search. A bomb squad and sniffer dogs were deployed for inspection of the premises, an official said. Shivakumar had suggested the possibility of the threat being a hoax in the morning.

5.title: Jagdeep Dhankhar will be an excellent, inspiring VP: PM Modi
5.article_body: Shortly after NDA Vice Presidential candidate Jagdeep Dhankhar filed his nomination on Monday, PM Narendra Modi said that he will be an excellent and inspiring VP. JP Nadda said Dhankhar is a "Kisan-Putra" (son of a farmer) who has established himself as a "people's governor". I will always strive to enhance the democratic values of India, Dhankhar said.

6.title: Shia group seeks ₹5 cr for renovation of Ashoorkhanas in Hyderabad
6.article_body: Ahead of Muharram, a Shia group has sought a special grant of ₹5 crore from the Telangana Minorities Welfare Ministry for repairs and renovation of Ashoorkhanas (places of mourning). The grant is sought for repairs in Hyderabad and other districts of Telangana. Muharram processions will be taken out in Hyderabad on August 8 and August 9.

7.title: Ex-NSE CEO Chitra's remand extended by 4 days in money laundering case
7.article_body: A Delhi court has extended the four-day remand of former CEO and MD of National Stock Exchange (NSE), Chitra Ramkrishna, in a money laundering case. The case involves alleged phone tapping and snooping of NSE's employees. Earlier, the Enforcement Directorate and CBI registered two more cases against Ramkrishna, former NSE head Ravi Narain and former Mumbai Police Commissioner Sanjay Pandey.

8.title: Governor office neither ornamental nor political: Vice President Naidu
8.article_body: Outgoing Vice President Venkaiah Naidu on Sunday stated that the office of a Governor is "neither an ornamental position nor a political position". He appealed the Governors to ensure that programs funded by the Centre are properly implemented by the states. Governors' conduct should set an example, a media release from Naidu's office quoted him as saying.

9.title: Margaret Alva is a better VP candidate than Dhankhar: Kharge
9.article_body: Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge has said that the Opposition candidate, Margaret Alva, for the Vice-President elections is a better one than the NDA candidate, Jagdeep Dhankhar. "Our candidate is from the minority and is better than their candidate. If they will support our candidate [Margaret Alva], then it will be a unanimous poll," Kharge said.

10.title: Ben Stokes retires from ODI cricket, says '3 formats are just unsustainable for me now'
10.article_body: England Test captain Ben Stokes has announced his retirement from ODI cricket, saying England's match against South Africa on Tuesday will be his last ODI. "Three formats are just unsustainable for me now," he stated. "It's time for someone else to progress as a cricketer and make incredible memories like I have over the past 11 years," he added.

11.title: Russia instructs its forces to destroy Ukraine's long-range weapons
11.article_body: Russian Defence Minister Sergei Shoigu has instructed the military's Vostok group's commander to prioritise destroying Ukraine's long-range missile and artillery weapons and "continue...intentional incineration of wheat fields," the Russian Defence Ministry said on Monday. Shoigu said that these weapons were being used to "shell residential areas" in the Russia-controlled Donbas region, it added.

12.title: Karnataka fits radio collars on 2 elephants to reduce human-animal conflicts
12.article_body: The Karnataka government's forest department has fitted radio collars on two elephants in MM Hills Wildlife Sanctuary to prevent human-animal conflicts in the nearby areas. A radio collar is a belt equipped with GPS and its real-time monitoring will send early warnings to forest staff. "We have received complaints that two tuskers often enter the village areas," an official said.

13.title: Company supervisor assaulted, robbed after taking shared cab in Gurugram
13.article_body: A private company's supervisor was allegedly assaulted and robbed by three men after the former took a shared cab from Gurugram's Vatika Chowk to Mathura. The accused took a detour and started beating the victim, Ramesh Kumar (45), before snatching two mobile phones and ₹29,000 cash from him, police said. The complaint was lodged at the Badshahpur Police Station.

14.title: Jharkhand woman kills husband for not allowing her to wear jeans
14.article_body: A woman killed her husband in Jharkhand's Jamtara after he allegedly stopped her from wearing jeans after marriage. The woman, Pushpa Hembrom, had an argument with her husband after she went to see a fair wearing jeans. She allegedly attacked him with knife during argument, leaving the victim grievously injured. He was rushed to hospital and later succumbed to injuries.

15.title: MP doctor, gunman frisk patients to seize tobacco; people say ‘inhuman act’
15.article_body: The civil surgeon of the Shahdol district hospital in Madhya Pradesh, while being escorted by a gunman and stick-wielding guards, frisked patients and their attendants to allegedly seize tobacco. Reports said that some people termed the act "inhuman". The surgeon said that this was being done to stop the patients from chewing tobacco and spitting in the hospital.

16.title: Yellow alert issued in Mumbai on Monday, water stock in lakes at 82%
16.article_body: IMD issued a yellow alert in Mumbai on Monday, even as the rain subsided in most parts of the state over the weekend. However, the water stock in lakes because of heavy rain is now at 82%, with three lakes having already overflowed. Furthermore, two more rain-related deaths were reported on Sunday, taking the season's total to 104 in Maharashtra.

17.title: 20 trains on Mumbai-Delhi route cancelled after train derails in Guj
17.article_body: 20 trains on the Mumbai-Delhi route have been cancelled and about 16 trains diverted after a goods train derailed on Monday in Gujarat. According to Western Railway, wagons of the goods train that were meant to transport coal were running empty when they overturned. Eyewitnesses told police and railway officials that the wagons derailed with a deafening noise.

18.title: Droupadi Murmu will win Prez polls by a huge margin: Karnataka CM
18.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai has said that the BJP-led NDA's Presidential candidate Droupadi Murmu will win the polls by a "huge majority". "There is every possibility of Murmu breaking all previous records in her margin of victory. Murmu is the personification of noble humane values," CM Bommai said. "Murmu has received support from several [non-NDA] parties too," he added.

19.title: ED questions Satyendar Jain's wife in money laundering case
19.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) on Monday questioned Delhi Minister Satyendar Jain's wife, Poonam Jain, in connection with a money laundering case. Earlier, Poonam was summoned by the ED on July 14. This comes months after the ED arrested Satyendar Jain on May 30 in connection with alleged hawala transactions related to a Kolkata-based company.

20.title: Rare white whale washes up on a beach in Australia, pic surfaces
20.article_body: A rare white whale washed up on a Victorian beach in Australia. Several people believed the whale that washed up to be the famous humpback Migaloo, which was first spotted off Byron Bay in 1991. However, the local environment department confirmed that it isn't Migaloo. Officials confirmed that the white whale is a sub-adult female, while Migaloo is a male.

21.title: Compensate COVID victims' families without wasting time: SC to states
21.article_body: The Supreme Court on Monday asked all states and Union Territories to pay compensation to the family members of COVID-19 victims without wasting any time. The court said that if any claimant has a grievance, they may approach the grievance redressal committee. The committee will have to decide the application of the claimant within four weeks.

22.title: Fortune cooking oil prices cut by up to ₹30 per litre by Adani Wilmar
22.article_body: Prices of one of the most popular Indian edible oil brands Fortune have been cut by up to ₹30 per litre amid a fall in global prices. This is the second oil price reduction announced by the brand's maker Adani Wilmar in two months. Prices of soyabean and sunflower oils have been cut to ₹165 and ₹195 per litre, respectively.

23.title: Deepika Padukone to play Parvati in 'Brahmastra 2': Report
23.article_body: Deepika Padukone will portray Parvati in 'Brahmastra 2', according to a report. The actress will reportedly also make a cameo appearance in 'Brahmastra Part One: Shiva', which is set to release in theatres on September 9. The upcoming film, starring Ranbir Kapoor, Amitabh Bachchan, Alia Bhatt and Nagarjuna Akkineni, will be released in multiple languages.

24.title: In a first, Cong fought Gwalior civic polls without Scindia and won: Digvijaya
24.article_body: Former Madhya Pradesh CM Digvijaya Singh has commented on Congress winning the Gwalior Municipal Corporation on Sunday. "For the first time, Congress fought the Gwalior local body polls without [Congress-turned BJP leader] Jyotiraditya Scindia and won it," Digvijaya said. He added, "This win should be noted by political observers." Notably, Scindia belongs to the Gwalior-based royal family.

25.title: Leopard rushed to police station after people climb cage for selfies in Gujarat
25.article_body: A caged leopard had to be rushed to the police station 10 km away after locals climbed on the cage and started taking selfies and videos of it in Gujarat. People rushed in large numbers to see the leopard and forest officials had a tough time controlling the mob. We covered the cage but public continued taking videos, officials said.

26.title: Rajesh Khanna was very generous, he bought houses for co-stars: Sharmila
26.article_body: Veteran actress Sharmila Tagore, who appeared with Rajesh Khanna in multiple films, has revealed that the late actor used to buy expensive gifts for his co-actors, colleagues and friends. "I have seen him be very generous...Sometimes he even bought them a house but in return, it seems Kaka had great expectations of them, which eventually strained his relations," Sharmila added.

27.title: Love you SRK for rehearsing with me, not throwing attitude: Kashmera on 'Yes..'
27.article_body: Actress Kashmera Shah took to Instagram to share a video from 'Yes Boss' and thanked actor Shah Rukh Khan for his support. "Today I completed 25 years in the Bollywood film industry...Thank you King Khan for putting me at comfort...Love you always for rehearsing with me and not throwing attitude of being the huge star that you were," she wrote.

28.title: COVID-19 outbreak at resort in China leaves 2,000 stranded
28.article_body: Over 2,000 tourists are stranded in the city of Beihai in China's Guangxi region after over 450 people tested positive for coronavirus over five days at a resort there, state media Global Times reported. Of the total, 444 were asymptomatic, according to a press briefing. The city is one of the most popular tourist destinations in Guangxi, the report said.

29.title: B'luru parks to remain open for extra hours following public demand
29.article_body: The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) has extended the timings of all parks within its limits by two and a half hours and now they will remain open from 5 am to 8 pm. Earlier, the parks used to open only from 5 am to 10 am and 4 pm to 8 pm. The decision was taken following public demand.

30.title: Convict who escaped Pune jail by removing roof tiles rearrested
30.article_body: Pune Rural Police have rearrested a 22-year-old convict who had fled from the Shirur police station last month. The accused, identified as Rohan Biru Sontakke, who is reportedly a history-sheeter, escaped after removing the roof tiles of the washroom attached to the lockup in the wee hours of June 23. Police nabbed Sontakke on Saturday after receiving a tip-off.

31.title: We're not getting to spend as much time together as I'd want: Janhvi on family
31.article_body: Janhvi Kapoor said in an interview that she would love to do a film with her actor-brother Arjun Kapoor. "We're all working so much, we're not getting to spend as much time together as a family as I'd want us to," she said, adding, "So I think the only way...to get...family together is to...do a film and cast everyone in...family."

32.title: I'd have definitely tried to hit another one: Sehwag on Pant's 5 consecutive fours
32.article_body: Team India wicketkeeper-batter Rishabh Pant smashed five consecutive fours off England pacer David Willey in the 42nd over in their final ODI on Sunday. Reacting to it, ex-India opener Virender Sehwag said, "I'd have definitely tried to hit [another] four or a six." India needed four runs to win off Willey's last delivery but Pant took a single.

33.title: When it was time to give relief, we burdened people: Varun on new GST rate
33.article_body: BJP MP Varun Gandhi criticised the central government over the latest increase in GST rates and said that when it was time to give people "relief", we are burdening them. Taking to Twitter, he wrote, "This decision, taken amid record-breaking unemployment, will further lighten the pockets of middle-class families and especially the struggling youth living in rented houses."

34.title: Helicopter returning after helping firefighters crashes in US; 4 dead
34.article_body: Four people died after a helicopter of Bernalillo County Sheriff's Office crashed near Las Vegas in US' New Mexico while it was returning after helping firefighters in another city in the state, authorities said on Sunday. The deceased include three personnel from the sheriff's office and one county firefighter. The cause of the incident is unknown and will be investigated.

35.title: Asked Musk how many kids he plans to have, he said 'Mars needs people': Mark Cuban
35.article_body: Billionaire Mark Cuban said that he once asked Elon Musk how many children he planned on having. "This was before the last three or whatever it was," Cuban said, likely referring to the three children Musk fathered in 2021. "I'm like, 'Dude, congratulations, how many you going to have?' He sends me a text back, 'Mars needs people'," Cuban recalled.

36.title: Solar storm to hit Earth tomorrow, may cause radio & GPS disruptions
36.article_body: A solar flare or solar storm that erupted from the Sun on July 14 is expected to hit Earth and disrupt radio and GPS signals early on July 19, experts have warned. Space weather expert Dr Tamitha Skov said that strong aurora or polar lights will also possibly be seen on Earth due to the solar storm.

37.title: Want to show people I'm more than simple, innocent: Janhvi on 'Good...'
37.article_body: Actress Janhvi Kapoor has said 'Good Luck Jerry' is a good opportunity to show people that she is more than simple, innocent and helpless. "I saw the original film...thought it was cool and funny...Nayanthara was just such a bada** in the film," she stated. Janhvi added, "Nayanthara in that film was...innocent and simple, but her character had a solid arc."

38.title: Rupee closes at an all-time low of 79.98 against US dollar
38.article_body: The rupee on Monday hit a fresh record low as it ended closer to the 80-mark to close at 79.98 against the US dollar. This was the seventh consecutive session when the rupee weakened. So far this year, the currency has weakened 7.05% against the US dollar. Meanwhile, BSE Sensex closed 760 points higher at 54,521 on Monday.

39.title: It's invaluable to have Hardik in Team India in white-ball cricket: Jaffer
39.article_body: Wasim Jaffer has said it's invaluable to have all-rounder Hardik Pandya in the Indian team in white-ball cricket. Hardik registered bowling figures of 7-3-24-4 and scored 71(55) in India's five-wicket win against England in third ODI. It was the 28-year-old's best-ever bowling figures in ODI cricket. India won the three-match ODI series 2-1. Hardik was adjudged 'Player of the Series'

40.title: That's the example you give: Zaheer on Hardik-Rishabh's 133 run partnership
40.article_body: Ex-India pacer Zaheer Khan has said the partnership between Rishabh Pant and Hardik Pandya in the third England ODI is the "example you'd like to give to anyone who is in the batting lineup". India were 72/4 when Hardik came in to bat alongside Pant. The duo added 133 runs for the fifth wicket, helping India win by five wickets.

41.title: HUL, ITC, United Spirits added 130 execs to crorepati club last fiscal: Report
41.article_body: Hindustan Unilever (HUL), ITC and United Spirits together added over 130 executives to the club of those earning more than ₹1 crore annually during the last fiscal, The Economic Times reported. United Spirits witnessed a massive jump of 113%, whereas HUL and ITC saw 33% and 44% increase in the number of eight-figure salary earners, as per their annual reports.

42.title: SRK's look from 'Dunki' leaked, actor spotted shooting in London
42.article_body: Actor Shah Rukh Khan's look from his upcoming film 'Dunki' has been leaked on social media. The actor was seen wearing a half-tucked plaid shirt along with black trousers and sporting a messy hair look while going for a shot on London's Waterloo Bridge. The film is directed by Rajkumar Hirani and also features Taapsee Pannu.

43.title: GST is now Gayi Saari Tankhvaah: Akhilesh criticises BJP over GST rates hike
43.article_body: SP chief Akhilesh Yadav has criticised the BJP-led Centre over the latest hike in GST rates by coining a new term for it "Gayi Saari Tankhvaah [Gone all salary]". This new term came because of the disappointment with the increased “burden” on the earnings of common citizens due to the hike in GST rates, Yadav said.

44.title: Stopped working with Rajesh Khanna, he came at 12pm for 9am shoot: Sharmila
44.article_body: Veteran actress Sharmila Tagore has revealed that the one thing about late actor Rajesh Khanna that affected her was his habit of coming late for work. The actress added that he never reached before 12pm for a 9am shift. "And that's why I decided to work with other actors despite knowing that our pairing was quite successful," Sharmila said.

45.title: BJP’s nomination of Murmu a 'masterstroke': Congress leader Rathva
45.article_body: Senior Gujarat Congress leader Sukhram Rathva on Monday said that fielding Droupadi Murmu, a tribal woman candidate for the post of President, was a "masterstroke" by the BJP.  "I hope that whoever gets elected to the post of President, he or she will implement the provisions of the Constitution," said Rathva.

46.title: BBMP collected ₹1.14 crore fine for plastic ban violations: Report
46.article_body: Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike reportedly collected ₹1.14 crore in penalty for violating the single-use plastic rule between September 2019 and June 2022. On Saturday alone, the civic body seized 122.3 kg of single-use plastic from 98 locations in the city and collected ₹77,100 as a fine on the same day. Manufacturers, retailers and small-scale business vendors were among the violators.

47.title: 8 out of 13 bodies of MP bus mishap victims identified, 5 from Maharashtra
47.article_body: Authorities have identified eight out of 13 bodies of victims who lost their lives in Madhya Pradesh's bus mishap on Monday. Officials said that five of those identified belonged to Maharashtra. Two others have been traced back to Rajasthan and one to Madhya Pradesh. Bus driver and conductor are among those killed in the incident. Their bodies have been recovered.

48.title: Hyderabad student bags all-India 3rd rank in ICSE Class 10 results
48.article_body: Hyderabad's Riya Susan Tony bagged all-India third rank in ICSE Class 10 results that were declared by CISCE on Sunday evening. Riya, a student of The Future Kid's School, secured 99.4% by scoring 497 marks out of 500. The third rank is being shared by 72 candidates as all of them scored 497 marks in the Class 10 board examination.

49.title: Hardik now knows when to bowl bouncer, there's better planning: RP Singh
49.article_body: Former India pacer RP Singh has said all-rounder Hardik Pandya has improved as a bowler after coming back from his back injury. "Earlier, Hardik used to run in hard and send down short balls. But now, he thinks hard and knows when to bowl the bouncer," explained Singh. Hardik registered his career-best ODI figures of 4/24 against England.

50.title: I'm not a criminal: Kejriwal over delay in nod for Singapore visit
50.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Monday said that he wasn't a "criminal", stressing that there's a "political reason" behind the delay in granting him permission to visit Singapore for a summit. Kejriwal said he was specially invited to the World Cities Summit in Singapore, where he would present the Delhi model before world leaders and bring laurels to India.

51.title: India reports its second monkeypox case in Kerala
51.article_body: India's second positive case of monkeypox has been confirmed in Kerala, the state's Health Ministry said on Monday. The case has been reported in Kerala's Kannur district, the state government said. The first case of the virus in the country was also reported in Kerala last week when a traveller from UAE tested positive.

52.title: Fraser-Pryce sets championship record in Jamaican sweep of women's 100m
52.article_body: Shelly-Ann Fraser-Pryce won her fifth world title in Jamaican female sprinters' clean sweep of the women's 100m in the ongoing World Athletics Championships. Fraser-Pryce won gold with a new championship record of 10.67 seconds. Shericka Jackson was second, clocking a personal best of 10.73 seconds, while the Tokyo Olympic champion Elaine Thompson-Herah finished third (10.81s).

53.title: Focussed on one ball at a time: Pant on match-winning ton vs England
53.article_body: Talking about his match-winning innings against England in third and final ODI, India wicketkeeper-batter Rishabh Pant said he was focussing on one ball at a time. "When your team is under pressure and you bat like that...something I aspire to do," he added. Chasing 260, Pant hit an unbeaten 125 to help India score 261/5 in 42.1 overs.

54.title: 'PS-1' director Mani Ratnam receives legal notice over Vikram's look: Report
54.article_body: Filmmaker Mani Ratnam and actor Vikram have reportedly received a legal notice from a lawyer over Vikram's look in the film 'Ponniyin Selvan'. As per the reports, the lawyer alleged Cholas didn't have a 'tilak' on the forehead. In the posters released earlier, Vikram, who plays Aditya Karikalan in the film, can be seen sporting a 'tilak'.

55.title: Grace & style of Dhanush is something to behold: Regé-Jean Page
55.article_body: Regé-Jean Page, speaking about Dhanush in 'The Gray Man', said, "The grace...style and badassery of that man, is something to behold...that's going to be a thunderbolt in the film." "If Batman was twice as badass, then he might get halfway to where Dhanush is in this film," he added. Ryan Gosling and Chris Evans feature in the film.

56.title: Some pap pics look vulgar, then people character assassinate you: Janhvi
56.article_body: Actress Janhvi Kapoor has stated that sometimes photos taken by paparazzi can look vulgar because they are "taken at a certain angle" or she is "photographed in a certain way". "People perceive you in a certain way and they character assassinate you, even though you make choices based on your comfort. That bothers me," the actress said.

57.title: How does the ODI team rankings table read after India's series victory?
57.article_body: Following their 2-1 ODI series victory against England, India are placed third on the ICC ODI team rankings table. India have accumulated 109 rating points, while fourth-placed Pakistan have 106 rating points. England are currently second with 121 rating points, while New Zealand lead the rankings with 128 rating points.

58.title: Moosewala's father cries while unveiling his statue, says 'can't see son as statue at 28'
58.article_body: Late singer Sidhu Moosewala's father Balkaur Singh broke down while unveiling a 6.5 feet statue of his son in Punjab's Mansa recently. "I can't bear to see my son as a statue at 28. We wait for justice. The killers, whether sitting on foreign soil or here, should be punished," he said. Sidhu Moosewala was shot dead on May 29.

59.title: Delighted to win civic polls in Gwalior; BJP has crash-landed: Jairam Ramesh
59.article_body: After winning the Gwalior Municipal Corporation, Congress MP Jairam Ramesh said, "Nothing has given me greater pleasure than the victory in Gwalior local body polls." "BJP has crash-landed there," Ramesh said. Notably, Gwalior and its nearby districts, including Guna, are considered as the family bastion of the Congress-turned BJP politician Jyotiraditya Scindia.

60.title: Emu runs on road, disrupts traffic in US' Texas; videos surface
60.article_body: Videos of an emu, a flightless bird, running loose on the road and disrupting traffic in Houston in US' Texas have surfaced online. According to local media, the emu was captured and returned to its owners safely. One of the videos of the incident showed three police cars following the emu as it walks on the streets in the area.

61.title: Rejected 'Judwaa 2', didn't want to do 'bachpan ka role': Siddharth Nigam
61.article_body: Actor Siddharth Nigam has revealed that he was offered to play Varun Dhawan's childhood character in the 2017 film 'Judwaa 2'. "I didn't want to do a 'bachpan ka role'. Otherwise, it becomes difficult to get roles as a male lead," he added. Siddharth further said he decided not to do "popular actors' bachpan ka role" after doing 'Dhoom 3'.

62.title: Tamil Nadu CM gets discharged from hospital, votes in Presidential poll
62.article_body: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin was discharged from Chennai's Kauvery Hospital on Monday after recovering from COVID-19 and went directly to the Secretariat complex to cast his vote in the Presidential poll. The ruling DMK and its allies are backing Opposition choice former Union Minister Yashwant Sinha. AIADMK is supporting Droupadi Murmu who is the nominee fielded by BJP.

63.title: School bus driver rapes 15-yr-old Dalit student in Pune, arrested
63.article_body: Pune Police have arrested a school bus driver for allegedly raping a 15-year-old Dalit student. According to police, accused contacted the girl on Saturday while she was attending tuition classes and later took her to a dilapidated building where he allegedly raped her. A case of rape has been filed under sections of IPC, POCSO Act and SC/ST Atrocities Act.

64.title: 2023 K'taka polls my last, won't contest from Chamundeshwari: Siddaramaiah
64.article_body: Congress leader and former Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah has said that 2023 Assembly elections would be his last. "I'm making it very very clear...I will not contest from Chamundeshwari again," he added. "We will make someone a candidate, ensure that he or she wins, he or she will be a Congress candidate...I will contest from wherever I'm asked to," Siddaramaiah said.

65.title: Singers want to be like Arijit today, they're losing their identities: Mame
65.article_body: Folk artist Mame Khan has said that he doesn't want to become Arijit Singh. "Today, all singers want to be like him, and in the process, are losing their identities," he added. "I choose to maintain my voice, which is why it is valued. I also celebrate my folk roots; it's the strongest aspect [of my personality]," Mame further said.

66.title: Man who stole 50 tear gas canisters from Sri Lankan police arrested
66.article_body: A 31-year-old man was arrested for allegedly stealing 50 tear gas canisters from police during protests near Parliament in Sri Lanka's Colombo, according to media reports. The suspect, who was reportedly a mason, was arrested on Sunday from his residence, the police said. The suspect had stolen the canisters last week as security forces tried to disperse the protesters.

67.title: Rupee hits record low of 79.97 against US dollar
67.article_body: The rupee hit a record low of 79.97 against the US dollar on Monday after opening at 79.76. The Finance Ministry, while speaking about the matter said that global factors such as the Russia-Ukraine war, soaring crude oil prices and tightening of global financial conditions are the major reasons for the rupee's weakening.

68.title: ICSE Class 10 topper from Pune hears the news during a birthday party
68.article_body: The all-India ICSE Class 10 topper, Hargun Kaur Matharu from Pune, got the news about her achievement when she was celebrating her younger sister's birthday. Matharu, who scored 99.8% in the exam, is tied for the top position with three other students. She said she wants to appear for the Joint Entrance Examination (JEE) and study coding.

69.title: No GST on pre-packed, labelled food items weighing over 25 kg: Finance Ministry
69.article_body: The Finance Ministry has clarified that single packages of pre-packed and labelled food items like cereals and pulses weighing over 25 kg are exempt from 5% GST. It added that if a retail shopkeeper supplies an item in a loose quantity that was bought in a 25-kg pack from a manufacturer, its sale to the consumer will not attract GST.

70.title: History tells you Shaheen Afridi blew them away: Nasser on India's top-order
70.article_body: Ex-England captain Nasser Hussain has said Team India's top-order batters struggle against left-arm pacers. "They need to play left-arm (pacers) a little bit better. History tells you that Shaheen Afridi blew them away one evening...And Reece Topley blew them away here (at Old Trafford)," he stated. Topley dismissed Shikhar Dhawan, Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli in the final England ODI.

71.title: I have voted for NDA's Presidential candidate Droupadi Murmu: Cong MLA
71.article_body: Odisha Congress MLA Mohammed Moquim on Monday said that he has voted for NDA's Presidential candidate Droupadi Murmu. "It's my personal decision as I have listened to my heart which guided me to do something for the soil and that's why [I] voted for her," he added. The Opposition has fielded Yashwant Sinha as their candidate for the post.

72.title: Scindia chairs meet with heads of airline companies on safety issues
72.article_body: Civil Aviation Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia chaired a one-on-one meeting with heads of airline companies on Monday to review flight safety norms. The Aviation Ministry also issued instructions to each airline to take steps at all levels to enhance security surveillance. These steps come after a few Indian airlines reported back-to-back incidents of emergency landings due to technical issues.

73.title: Physio loses ₹1.17 lakh to fraudsters posing as army personnel
73.article_body: A physiotherapist was cheated of ₹1.17 lakh by fraudsters posing as army personnel saying 22 CISF personnel needed physiotherapy. The Borivali West-based physiotherapist received a call from a man posing as CISF Director General to approve payment. The victim opened payment mode in his digital wallet, entered the credit card number told by the fraudster and his own UPI pin.

74.title: Protest held against Sudan's military govt over tribal clashes
74.article_body: A protest was held in Sudan's capital Khartoum on Sunday against the military government over the tribal clashes in the Blue Nile province. Security forces used tear gas against the protesters as they marched towards the Presidential Palace. This comes as a senior health official said on Sunday that the death toll from the violence has risen to 65.

75.title: Who are the 4 students who jointly secured 1st rank in ICSE Class 10 exams?
75.article_body: Four students, including three girls, jointly secured the first rank in ICSE Class 10 exams, results for which were declared on Sunday. Hargun Kaur Matharu from Maharashtra's Pune, Pushkar Tripathi from UP's Balrampur, Anika Gupta from UP's Kanpur and Kanishka Mittal from UP's Kanpur all secured the first rank with 99.8% marks. The overall pass percentage for ICSE was 99.97%.

76.title: 22-yr-old female teacher kidnapped by gym trainer in UP's Gonda
76.article_body: A 22-year-old female teacher was allegedly kidnapped by a gym trainer in UP’s Gonda district in Nawabganj region. An FIR has been filed against the suspect, according to the police. Tej Pratap Singh, SHO of Nawabganj, said people saw the teacher travelling in an e-rickshaw on Sunday evening when an SUV approached and purportedly forced her to get inside car.

77.title: 2 Kanwar Yatris returning after collecting holy water die as bus hits bike
77.article_body: Two Kanwar Yatris who were reportedly returning after collecting holy water as part of the yatra rituals, were killed after a bus allegedly rammed into the motorcycle that they were travelling on.  The deceased have been identified as Moradabad residents Rahul and Gaurav. Reports said that the two were immediately hospitalised but passed away while undergoing treatment.

78.title: Alt News' Zubair seeks urgent SC hearing to quash 6 FIRs against him
78.article_body: Alt News Co-founder Mohammed Zubair on Monday sought an urgent listing of his plea in the Supreme Court seeking to quash all six FIRs registered against him in Uttar Pradesh for allegedly outraging religious feelings. The fresh plea of Zubair has also challenged the constitution of the Special Investigation Team (SIT) by the state government to probe the six cases.

79.title: Only Delhi govt providing respite from inflation via its schemes: Kejriwal
79.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Monday said that the Delhi government is the only one that is providing any respite from growing inflation through its many schemes. "I demand the central government to take back GST applied on materials of everyday use of basic food products, it is not right," Kejriwal added.

80.title: Yashwant called Mulayam an ISI agent, can't support him: Shivpal
80.article_body: Amid ongoing voting for Presidential polls, Pragatisheel Samajwadi Party (Lohia) chief Shivpal Yadav said that he can't back Yashwant Sinha as the latter had called Samajwadi Party (SP) patriarch Mulayam Singh Yadav 'ISI agent'. "Hardcore SP leaders...who follow [Mulayamji's] principles [won't] support a candidate who levelled such allegations," he added. Notably, SP had extended support to Sinha.

81.title: Manmohan Singh arrives in wheelchair to cast vote for Presidential poll
81.article_body: Former Prime Minister and Congress MP Manmohan Singh reached Parliament in a wheelchair to cast his vote for the Presidential election on Monday. Singh was helped by four officials to get up from his wheelchair and cast his vote. He had taken a leave of absence for the entire Winter Session of Parliament in 2021 on health grounds.

82.title: Jagdeep Dhankhar, NDA's Vice President candidate, files nomination papers
82.article_body: Jagdeep Dhankhar, former Bengal governor and now Bharatiya Janata Party-led National Democratic Alliance's nominee for Vice President, filed nomination papers on Monday. Dhankhar will compete with former Rajasthan governor and five-term parliamentarian, Margaret Alva, in the race to replace M Venkaiah Naidu as India's Vice President. Alva is the opposition's candidate for the position.

83.title: Yuvraj's '45-minute conversation' tweet for Pant after his first-ever ODI ton goes viral
83.article_body: Former India all-rounder Yuvraj Singh's tweet praising Rishabh Pant after his maiden ODI hundred has gone viral. "Looks like the 45-minute conversation made sense! Well played Rishabh Pant...that's how you pace your innings. Hardik Pandya, great to watch," Yuvraj wrote. Yuvraj's tweet indicated that he had a 45-minute conversation with the India wicketkeeper-batter over his batting.

84.title: What is the deadly Ebola-like Marburg virus disease reported in Ghana?
84.article_body: An outbreak of Marburg virus disease has been reported in Ghana. As per WHO, Marburg virus disease is a highly virulent disease that causes haemorrhagic fever, with fatality ratio of up to 88%. It's in the same family as virus that causes Ebola. A type of fruit bat, Rousettus aegyptiacus, is considered to be the natural host of the virus.

85.title: Ranbir always caught my attention with his work: 'Shamshera' director
85.article_body: 'Shamshera' director Karan Malhotra has said that he is happy that he got to work with actor Ranbir Kapoor so early in his career. "Ranbir always caught my attention with his work...the timing was correct...things just fell into place for us," he added. Karan stated that Sanjay Dutt is like a family and added he didn't have any drama.

86.title: Hardik was unlucky not to be 'Player of the Match' in 3rd ODI: Hogg
86.article_body: Following India's five-wicket win against England in third ODI, Brad Hogg said all-rounder Hardik Pandya was unlucky not to be adjudged 'Player of the Match' after Rishabh Pant(125*) was named the one. He added that Hardik showed a "brilliant" all-round performance with four crucial wickets and a strike rate of 129.09 with the bat. Hardik scored 71 in 55 balls.

87.title: Vegetable supply dips in Mumbai, cauliflower touches 100/kg: Report
87.article_body: The overall supply of vegetables in Mumbai’s wholesale market dropped by 40%, a trader at the Agriculture Produce Market Committee (APMC) said. The reasons which led to the dip in supply of vegetables are heavy rainfall, one-day token strike against 5% GST followed by weekend. The prices of cauliflower touched ₹100 per kg in retail, reports said.

88.title: Police produces 120 accused in Kallakurichi court over violence in town
88.article_body: Tamil Nadu Police on Monday produced 120 accused in Tamil Nadu's Kallakurichi court in connection with the violence that erupted in the town on Sunday. The violence erupted over the death of a class 12 girl who allegedly died by suicide, alleging torture by teachers. The protesters broke barricades, stormed the school premises, and set buses on fire, reports said.

89.title: Outbreak of deadly Ebola-like Marburg virus disease declared in Ghana
89.article_body: Ghana has declared the country's first outbreak of deadly Ebola-like Marburg virus disease after two cases were identified for the first time in the African nation. A 26-year-old male and a 51-year-old male passed away due to the virus in southern Ashanti region of Ghana. More than 90 contacts of the deceased patients have been identified and are being monitored.

90.title: Army Captain, junior officer killed in accidental grenade blast in J&K
90.article_body: Army Captain Anand and Junior Commissioned Officer (JCO) Naib Subedar Bhagwan Singh were killed in an accidental grenade blast, which took place along the Line of Control in Jammu and Kashmir's Poonch on Sunday late night, officials said. According to PRO Defence Lieutenant Colonel Devender Anand, the blast happened when Indian Army troops were performing their duties in Mendhar sector.

91.title: I'm not the one to try and run before I can walk: Buttler on captaincy
91.article_body: England white-ball captain Jos Buttler has said he needs "time and experience" as skipper after England lost both the T20I and the ODI series to India. "I'm not one to try and run before I can walk," stated Buttler. "I'm an experienced cricketer but I'm a young captain...I've got lots to learn, lots to try and work out," he explained.

92.title: SpaceX launches 53 Starlink satellites in its 31st mission of 2022
92.article_body: SpaceX launched a batch of 53 Starlink satellites atop a Falcon 9 rocket in its 31st mission this year on Sunday. This was the 13th flight for the Falcon 9 first stage booster supporting this mission, SpaceX said. The booster has previously launched Dragon's first crew demonstration mission and now 10 Starlink missions.

93.title: Drug addict steals valuables from Delhi railway station waiting room, held
93.article_body: A drug addict who used to steal passengers' valuables from the waiting rooms of Old Delhi Railway Station has been arrested by the police. "He is a drug addict and in order to fulfil his drug requirements, he commits crime like theft," the police said. The incident came to light when one passenger found her bag missing.

94.title: Kajol to make web series debut, says 'Love to take challenges head-on'
94.article_body: Kajol is set to make her web series debut with an upcoming project. Speaking about it, she said, "Exploring new formats is always a challenge; but...I love to take challenges head-on." "Being an avid fan of digital series...the concept has always been intriguing," she added. Kajol was last seen in the film 'Tribhanga', which premiered on an OTT platform.

95.title: 2 cases of Omicron sub-variant BA.2.75 detected in Singapore
95.article_body: Two individuals with a travel history to India have tested positive for Omicron sub-variant BA.2.75, nicknamed Centaurus, in Singapore, local media reported citing the country's health ministry. The ministry said that the two individuals had isolated themselves immediately after testing positive for COVID-19. It added that the patients have made a full recovery since then.

96.title: Want President who looks into misuse of constitutional institutions: Tejashwi
96.article_body: As voting for Presidential poll is underway, RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav on Monday said there is a "threat" to democracy. "In this country, there's a state of anarchy…The misuse of constitutional institutions is rampant. We would want a President who looks into it," he added. "Our PM doesn't even discuss the issues facing the youth or the farmers," he stated.

97.title: Batra quits as IOA President, FIH Chief, IOC member; pics of resignation letters surface
97.article_body: Narinder Batra has stepped down as the Indian Olympic Association (IOA) President, International Olympic Committee (IOC) member and International Hockey Federation (FIH) Chief due to personal reasons. Pictures of his three resignation letters all dated July 18, 2022 have surfaced online. In June, the Delhi High Court had ordered Batra to stop functioning as IOA President in a contempt proceeding.

98.title: Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation's half resources have come from Warren: Bill Gates
98.article_body: In a blog, Microsoft Co-founder Bill Gates said that though the foundation is named Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation, "half of its resources to date have come from Warren Buffett's gifts". Gates wrote, "Since 2006, Warren has gifted the foundation $35.7 billion, including his most recent gift of $3.1 billion in June."

99.title: 8-yr-old Aditya Patil wins Dance Deewane Juniors, says 'Will buy a big house'
99.article_body: Aditya Patil has won the first season of the talent reality show 'Dance Deewane Juniors'. The eight-year-old, who is from Gujarat's Surat, was awarded the trophy and ₹20 lakh cash prize. Talking about how he wants to spend the prize money, Aditya told ETimes, "I will give the winning amount to my grandfather and we will buy a big house."

100.title: This GST rate hike is breathtakingly irresponsible: Shashi Tharoor
100.article_body: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor has criticised the BJP-led Centre for the new hiked GST rates implemented from Monday. "This GST rate hike is breathtakingly irresponsible at a time of mounting economic difficulties for most Indians," Tharoor said. "The common citizen will bear the brunt of the burden even as inflation eats into his earnings," he added.

101.title: 99 killed in recent gang violence in Haiti's Cite Soleil: UN
101.article_body: The United Nations (UN) human rights office has said 99 people were killed recently amid fighting between rival gangs in the Cite Soleil area in Haiti's capital Port-au-Prince. It added that it's "deeply concerned by worsening violence" in Port-au-Prince. A UN human rights body's spokesperson said that 934 killings have been documented across the capital from January to June end.

102.title: Pant did what Jos Buttler couldn't do for England: Ojha
102.article_body: Former India cricketer Pragyan Ojha has said India wicketkeeper-batter Rishabh Pant challenged himself "mentally" in his unbeaten 125-run innings in the third ODI against England. "Pant has maturity and temperament. He has already displayed the qualities in Test cricket. [And now], he [has] shown the same in one-day cricket...He did what Jos Buttler couldn't do for England," stated Ojha.

103.title: RBI is of the view that cryptocurrencies should be prohibited: FM Sitharaman
103.article_body: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) has recommended to the government that it should frame regulations for cryptocurrencies and is of the view that they should be prohibited, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said. Citing the borderless nature of cryptocurrencies, she further said that any legislation for regulation or for banning can be effective only after significant international collaboration.

104.title: Very heavy rainfall warning in several states; IMD releases list
104.article_body: The IMD has predicted isolated very heavy rainfall in Himachal Pradesh, Uttar Pradesh, Maharashtra, Uttarakhand, east Rajasthan and west Madhya Pradesh between July 18 and 20. Meanwhile, isolated very heavy rainfall is also likely over Arunachal Pradesh, Assam and Meghalaya from July 18 to 21. IMD warned about localised flooding of roads and waterlogging in low lying areas.

105.title: Gabbar Singh strikes again: Rahul criticises Centre over GST rates hike
105.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi criticised the Centre over the latest increase in GST rates by comparing the rates of various commodities before and after the hike through a picture shared by him on Twitter. "Gabbar Singh [GST] strikes again," Rahul tweeted. He added, "BJP [shows their] masterclass on how to destroy what was once one of the world's fastest-growing economies."

106.title: Excited to announce my next film starring Kartik Aaryan: Kabir Khan
106.article_body: Filmmaker Kabir Khan took to Instagram to announce his upcoming project with actor Kartik Aaryan. "I'm excited to announce my next project starring Kartik in a never before seen avatar," he wrote on Instagram. Kabir added the project will be based on a "fascinating true story". "We start shooting early next year," he further added.

107.title: Shiv Sena doesn't see Prez polls as any political election: Aaditya
107.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Aaditya Thackeray said that his party believes that Presidential polls are different from any political election. Stating that the party is supporting Droupadi Murmu in the ongoing Presidential polls, he added, "It's the highest post and votes should be cast for a suitable candidate." Earlier, he had said that Murmu is a tribal and we support tribals.

108.title: Kallakurichi student's father suspects murder, Madras HC orders fresh autopsy
108.article_body: Madras High Court has ordered a fresh autopsy of the Class 12 girl student, who allegedly died by suicide, after the victim's father moved the court, seeking a second post-mortem examination, suspecting it to be a murder. Reports said that the post-mortem report stated that the victim appeared to have died of haemorrhage and shock due to multiple injuries.

109.title: 82-yr-old Pune man robbed of ₹19,000 he had collected for Haj pilgrimage
109.article_body: An 82-year-old man was robbed of ₹19,000, which he had collected as donations for his Haj pilgrimage, by a fraudster on the pretext of doubling the amount near a mosque in Bhavani Peth, Pune. The accused tricked the victim by diverting his attention before fleeing from the spot, police said. Notably, the victim worked as a daily wage labourer.

110.title: 12 people killed in flash floods in China; thousands evacuated
110.article_body: At least 12 people were killed and 12 others are missing after flash floods hit northwest and southwest China, state media reported on Sunday. While at least six people were reported dead in Sichuan, the remaining were recorded in Gansu. Thousands of people have also been evacuated. This comes as parts of the country are facing a heat wave.

111.title: Kallakurichi student death case transferred to CBCID, 3 school officials arrested
111.article_body: The investigation related to the death of a 17-year-old student in Tamil Nadu's Kallakurichi has been transferred to the CBCID, Tamil Nadu DGP announced. The police have also arrested three persons, including the correspondent, secretary and the principal of the ECR Sakthi International school, reports said. Violent protests had also taken place in front of the school.

112.title: Plea to stop SpiceJet's operations amid recent mishaps dismissed by Delhi HC
112.article_body: The Delhi High Court dismissed a plea seeking to stop the operations of SpiceJet over recent technical snags. The plea cited several incidents involving SpiceJet flights and claimed that passengers' lives are at risk due to their improper management. The DGCA has taken note of incidents involving SpiceJet flights and is free to proceed on its own, the court noted.

113.title: Elect me to save democracy: Yashwant Sinha on Presidential poll
113.article_body: As the voting for the Presidential election is underway, Opposition candidate Yashwant Sinha on Monday said that this poll is important and will set a path for the country’s democracy. "I appeal to all voters to listen to their hearts. This is a secret ballot, I hope they'll use their discretion and elect me to save democracy," Sinha added.

114.title: Had no money, cried myself to sleep: Monica Chauudhary on struggling days
114.article_body: Actress Monica Chauudhary, known for shows like 'Apharan' and 'Salt City', spoke about her struggling days in Mumbai and said that she sometimes had no money for food. "On those nights, I have cried myself to sleep, thinking that I should go back," she added. Monica further said she was "kicked out of" many shows and films.

115.title: Was literally a father figure to Arjun Kapoor when he was young: Sanjay
115.article_body: Actor Sanjay Kapoor, opening up about his relationship with nephew and actor Arjun Kapoor, has said, "I have literally brought him up." He added, "Arjun and I have spent the most amount of time together. It may not seem like that right now, but when Arjun was very young, I was literally a father figure to him."

116.title: It's outstanding how Pant comes up with series-changing knocks: Jaffer
116.article_body: Praising India wicketkeeper-batter for his unbeaten 125-run innings in the final ODI against England, Wasim Jaffer said it's outstanding how the 24-year-old comes up with "series-changing" knocks. "Pant is in brilliant form and has already played some incredible knocks in his short career," he added. Pant had scored a century and a fifty in the one-off Test against England.

117.title: Prez should be able to guide govt on economy: Akhilesh on supporting Yashwant
117.article_body: SP chief Akhilesh Yadav said that he will cast vote for Opposition's Presidential candidate Yashwant Sinha today. "There should be someone in the country who can tell the government the situation of the economy, from time to time. Look at Sri Lanka's condition. So, there should be President who can say that from time to time," he said.

118.title: Tiger attacks 2 bike-borne men near Corbett in Almora, drags 1 in forest
118.article_body: A tiger attacked two bike-borne men and dragged one of them into nearby forest near the Corbett Tiger Reserve in Uttarakhand’s Almora, forest officials said. The incident occurred on Saturday night. “A tiger hiding in the bushes attacked them,” an official said. “So far, the teams have not been able to locate the man or the tiger,” said another official.

119.title: Delhi-NCR rains to intensify, forecast expected after assessment: IMD
119.article_body: India Meteorological Department (IMD) has said that rainfall will intensify in Delhi-NCR on Tuesday or Wednesday. "By Monday, we will know better how much moisture is expected to come towards the region and based on that, a forecast on the intensity of rains expected can be made," an IMD scientist said on the development.

120.title: Woman who protested against war on Russian TV allegedly detained
120.article_body: Marina Ovsyannikova, a Russian woman who protested against Ukraine war on state TV in March, was allegedly detained briefly in Moscow on Sunday, according to her social media posts. Ovsyannikova shared pictures of the incident and claimed that she was going to walk her dogs when "people in uniform" approached her. Later, she stated on Facebook that she'd returned home.

121.title: 12 people dead as bus heading to Pune falls into Narmada River in MP
121.article_body: At least 12 people have died after a Maharashtra Roadways bus going from Indore to Pune fell into Narmada River in Madhya Pradesh's Dhar district, Madhya Pradesh Minister Narottam Mishra said. As many as 15 people have been rescued, the minister added. The bus was carrying around 50-60 passengers, according to reports.

122.title: Sunak praises father-in-law Narayana Murthy, says 'His firm employs thousands in UK'
122.article_body: One of the frontrunners for the UK PM's post, Rishi Sunak, said he is proud of what his parents-in-law built. Speaking about Infosys Founder NR Narayana Murthy, Sunak said, "My father-in-law came from...nothing and just had a dream and a couple of hundred pounds [from my] mother-in-law's savings…He...built one of the world's largest...companies that...employs thousands of people...in the UK."

123.title: Pic of Shah Rukh Khan shooting for 'Dunki' in London goes viral
123.article_body: A picture of actor Shah Rukh Khan from the sets of Rajkumar Hirani's 'Dunki' in London has gone viral on social media. He was spotted shooting at London's Waterloo for 'Dunki'. The film also features actress Taapsee Pannu. 'Dunki' is set to be based on an illegal route called the 'Donkey Flight' used by Indians to immigrate to other countries.

124.title: After 13.5 yrs, ‘most wanted’ couple held for killing Panchkula man over money
124.article_body: "Most wanted" couple, Raju and his wife Shilpa, has been arrested for murdering a Panchkula financier 13.5 years ago and throwing his four-year-old alive son into a canal. Reports said that in 2009, financier Vinod Mittal had lent money to Raju and Shilpa for a salon. Problems surfaced when Mittal asked for his money back, following which he was stabbed.

125.title: Google removes 8 apps infected with new 'Autolycos' malware from Play Store
125.article_body: Google has removed eight apps infected with a new Android malware named 'Autolycos' from Play Store. According to Bleeping Computer, the malware executes URLs on a remote browser and then includes the result in HTTP requests. The removed apps include Vlog Star Video Editor, Creative 3D Launcher, Wow Beauty Camera, Funny Camera, Razer Keyboard & Theme, and Gif Emoji Keyboard.

126.title: What goods & services get cheaper as new GST rates come into effect today?
126.article_body: Electric vehicles, whether or not fitted with a battery pack, will be eligible for the concessional GST rate of 5% from July 18. GST on renting trucks, and goods carriages (where the cost of fuel is included) will be cut to 12% from 18%. GST on ostomy appliances and orthopaedic equipment like splints will be reduced from 12% to 5%.

127.title: Working with Salman Khan in 'Kabhi...' is big opportunity: Siddharth
127.article_body: Speaking about working with Salman Khan in 'Kabhi Eid Kabhi Diwali', Siddharth Nigam has said, "Sharing screen space with Salman...is a big opportunity...it's a special moment for me." "I'm...fortunate that I got this offer...I hope it works out well," he added. Siddharth and Jassie Gill joined the project after Aayush Sharma and Zaheer Iqbal reportedly walked out from the movie.

128.title: Mom used to visit Tirupati temple on her b'day, stopped after marriage: Janhvi
128.article_body: Actress Janhvi Kapoor has revealed that her late actress-mother Sridevi used to visit the Tirupati temple on her birthday every year but stopped after her marriage. "An inner voice told me to visit the temple on her birthday and I started going there on her birthdays. Now, the new year has also been added to that list," she added.

129.title: PTI leader displays weapons on visit to polling stations in Pak; held
129.article_body:
Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf (PTI) leader Shahbaz Gill was arrested on Sunday from Muzaffargarh 
after he allegedly carried and displayed weapons on his visit to polling stations amid by-elections in Pakistan's Punjab. Following the arrest, PTI leaders criticised the move claiming it was an attempt to "rig the elections". A police official told Dawn that Gill was taken to an undisclosed location.

130.title: Kylie Jenner, Travis criticised for 'flaunting private jets' after hug pic goes viral
130.article_body: Kylie Jenner is facing criticism after posting a black-and-white photo of her, Travis Scott and their daughter Stormi Webster hugging each other while standing in between two private planes on a tarmac. "You wanna take mine or yours," Kylie wrote. Social media users accused them of "flaunting" their private jets, with one saying, "Maybe take neither and reduce...carbon footprint."

131.title: It was one of those series where top order didn't come to the party: Rohit
131.article_body: India captain Rohit Sharma, on being asked whether he's worried about top-order batters, said the top-order, including himself, got out to poor shots in the third England ODI. He added, "I still back those guys (Virat and Dhawan) to come out good." Rohit further said, "[It was] one of those series where the top order didn't come to the party."

132.title: Rishabh Pant's fearless mentality sets him apart: Jos Buttler
132.article_body: England white-ball captain Jos Buttler said there are many "stroke players" in the world but India wicketkeeper-batter Rishabh Pant is a "fearless player". Buttler added, "Pant is great for the game in all the formats...It's probably his mentality that sets him apart." The 24-year-old scored his maiden ODI hundred on Sunday to help India win three-match series against England.

133.title: Ranthambore tigers move closer to human habitats as their population rises
133.article_body: The population of tigers in Rajasthan's Ranthambore Tiger Reserve (RTR) has seen a 45% growth in last eight years due to which several tigers are moving out and posing danger to nearby human habitats, officials said. The reserve had 59 tigers in 2014 and now it has 86 living in an area of 1,334 square km, according to official data.

134.title: Saudi Arabia doubled Russian oil imports in Q2, freeing up own oil for exports: Report
134.article_body: The world's largest oil exporter, Saudi Arabia, more than doubled its Russian oil imports in the second quarter, enabling it to free up its own crude for export, as per data accessed by Reuters. It imported 6,47,000 tonnes of Russian oil from April to June. Russia has been selling fuel at discounted prices amid Western sanctions over the Ukraine war.

135.title: Hyd authority's one-time scheme offers 90% waiver on property tax arrears
135.article_body: The Telangana government has announced a one-time scheme (OTS) for clearing pending property tax arrears within Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) limits and all other urban local bodies. The scheme will allow a waiver of 90% on interest payment, provided that the principal amount plus 10% of interest on accumulated arrears is paid in one go for financial year 2021-22.

136.title: PM Modi casts his vote to elect the President; pic surfaces
136.article_body: PM Narendra Modi has cast his vote as the election to elect the new President of India began on Monday. Gujarat CM Bhupendra Patel, Odisha CM Naveen Patnaik, Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath and other MPs and MLAs also voted. NDA fielded Droupadi Murmu as their candidate, while the Opposition fielded Yashwant Sinha for the post.

137.title: There should be dialogue in Parliament with open mind: PM Modi
137.article_body: Ahead of monsoon session, PM Narendra Modi on Monday said there should be a dialogue in Parliament with an open mind. "If necessary, there should be debate. I urge all MPs to contemplate deeply and discuss," PM Modi added. "This session is also important because elections for office of President and Vice President are taking place right now," he stated.

138.title: Milkman dies after being hit by speeding car in Navi Mumbai
138.article_body: A milkman died after being thrown off the road along with his scooter by a speeding car at Palm Beach Road, Navi Mumbai. The incident happened when the deceased, Manoj Kumar (27), was returning home from NRI Estate on Sunday. Meanwhile, the car driver, Akshay Surve (25), crashed into a road divider and landed on the opposite side, police said.

139.title: Swiggy delivery boy riding motorcycle helps Zomato delivery boy on cycle, clip goes viral
139.article_body: A video of a Swiggy delivery boy on a motorcycle helping a Zomato delivery boy who was riding a bicycle in Delhi is going viral on social media. The video shows the Swiggy agent holding his hand so that the Zomato agent wouldn't have to pedal. "Divided by work and united by humanity," a social media user reacted.

140.title: Tell them Queen: Priyanka to Sushmita on reacting to 'gold digger' remark
140.article_body: Reacting to being called a gold digger, Sushmita Sen penned a note on Instagram and wrote, "I always (famously) preferred diamonds! And yes, I still buy them myself!" Several celebrities reacted to Sushmita's post. Actress Priyanka Chopra commented, "Tell em, Queen!" Other celebrities like Ranveer Singh, Neha Dhupia and Suniel Shetty also reacted to Sushmita's post.

141.title: My wife said, 'It's too much': Chris on his 'Love & Thunder' physique
141.article_body: Actor Chris Hemsworth has revealed his wife Elsa Pataky's reaction to his bulky physique in 'Thor: Love and Thunder'. "My wife was like, 'Bleh, it's too much'," he stated. Chris further added, "There are a lot of my male friends who are like, 'Yeah!' but a lot of female friends and family are like, 'Yuck'." Taika Waititi directed the film.

142.title: Man gets Chandigarh hotel's number online to book room, loses ₹28,000
142.article_body: A man, who wanted to book a room in one of the hotels in Chandigarh, ended up losing ₹28,000 to a fraudster after he dialled the number he got from the internet. He said he was asked to share an OTP once he called on the number. Upon sharing the OTP, ₹28,000 were debited from his account in two transactions.

143.title: Stats say Murmu will become 1st tribal woman President of India: BJP MLA
143.article_body: BJP MLA from Darjeeling, Neeraj Tamang Zimba, on Monday said that according to the statistics, NDA candidate Droupadi Murmu will become the first tribal woman President of the country. "This (Presidential poll) is just a formality. She has already won…It's a joyous occasion. There's support from everywhere. It is historic," Zimba added before voting began for the Presidential election.

144.title: 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign aims to take patriotism into hearts of people: Shah
144.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Sunday interacted with CMs of all states/UTs to discuss the 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign under the Azadi Ka Amrit Mahotsav, an official statement said. "It’s a programme to take the spirit of patriotism to the highest level into the hearts and minds of the people," Shah said.

145.title: Brewpub in Germany offers beer for sunflower oil amid shortages
145.article_body: A brewpub in Germany's Munich is offering its customers a litre of beer in exchange for the same quantity of sunflower oil amid shortages due to the Russia-Ukraine war. "The whole thing came up because we simply ran out of oil in the kitchen," the brewpub's manager told Reuters TV. The brewpub's manager said that getting oil is "very difficult".

146.title: Voting to elect the President of India begins
146.article_body: The voting for the Presidential election began on Monday, with MPs and MLAs across the country casting their votes. NDA has nominated Droupadi Murmu as their candidate while the Opposition fielded Yashwant Sinha as their candidate for the post. Earlier, Shiv Sena's faction led by Uddhav Thackeray expressed support for Murmu, while AAP said it would support Sinha.

147.title: Ukrainian Prez Zelenskyy fires security chief, Prosecutor General
147.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has dismissed the nation's Security Service Head and the Prosecutor General, citing hundreds of cases of treason and collaboration with Russia within their departments. "In particular, more than 60 employees of the prosecutor's office and...Security Service of Ukraine remained in...[Russia-occupied territory] and are working against our state," he said.

148.title: Used to work on 5 films together, focus is on 1 project today: Sanjay Kapoor
148.article_body: Actor Sanjay Kapoor has said that he earlier used to work on five films together. "Today, we maintain focus on a single project and that's the reason why the quality has really improved when it comes to performances, continuity, and many different aspects of filmmaking," he added. "One remains in character for a longer time," Sanjay further said.

149.title: Shanaya has been training for 8-9 yrs to become an actress: Sanjay
149.article_body: Actor Sanjay Kapoor has said that his daughter Shanaya Kapoor has been training for 8-9 years to become an actress. "This is a wonderful industry to work in and it was Shanaya's decision to be an actor...She was always attending her dance classes, diction training and what not," he added. Shanaya is yet to make her Bollywood debut.

150.title: Video shows iPhone lodged with a bullet after it saves Ukrainian soldier's life
150.article_body: A video has gone viral on social media purportedly showing an iPhone 11 Pro stuck with a bullet after it saved a Ukrainian soldier's life. The clip shows the damaged iPhone being taken out of the soldier's backpack after the shot was fired. The bullet couldn't penetrate the iPhone through the backpack, creating a clear bulge and shattering its screen.

151.title: 27-yr-old American woman fakes kidnapping in Delhi to get money from parents
151.article_body: A 27-year-old US citizen staying in Delhi allegedly faked her abduction after running out of money in an attempt to extort cash from her parents, police said. In an email to her parents, she said she was in an unsafe environment and being assaulted. Police found her staying with a Nigerian man she befriended in Greater Noida.

152.title: Told my captain even if I go for sixes, I'll try the short balls: Hardik
152.article_body: All-rounder Hardik Pandya said he used the short balls in the third ODI against England as the wicket was not ideal to bowl full. "Told my captain even if I go for sixes...[I'll try short balls because] if I take a wicket, it'll make a difference," added Hardik. "In ODIs, [batters] have to take on the short ball," he stated.

153.title: Acting in Hindi is a little out of my comfort zone for now: Allu Arjun
153.article_body: 'Pushpa' actor Allu Arjun in an interview said, "Acting in Hindi is a little out of my comfort zone for now, but once there's a requirement, I'll go all-out." Earlier, he stated that he does not wish to play a 'second role' in Hindi movies. Allu Arjun is currently working on 'Pushpa: The Rule', the sequel to 'Pushpa: The Rise'.

154.title: No option other than dialogue with Pak to resolve Kashmir issue: Mufti
154.article_body: PDP chief Mehbooba Mufti said that there is no option other than holding dialogue with Pakistan and other stakeholders to resolve the Kashmir issue and stop the bloodshed. Her statement came after a CRPF officer was killed by militants in Pulwama on Sunday. She further said that her party always believed that bullets or grenades cannot solve an issue.

155.title: New Zealand inflation surges to 7.3%, highest since 1990
155.article_body: Inflation in New Zealand has surged at its fastest pace in over three decades. As per official data, the Consumer Price Index increased 7.3% in the second quarter, up from 6.9% in the first quarter and the fastest since the June quarter of 1990 when prices rose 7.6%. Economists had predicted that inflation would come in at 7% or 7.1%.

156.title: SEBI clears appointment of BSE chief Ashish Chauhan as new NSE CEO & MD
156.article_body: The Securities and Exchange Board of India has approved the appointment of Ashish Kumar Chauhan as the new MD and CEO of the NSE. Chauhan is currently the MD and CEO of the BSE and will replace Vikram Limaye whose term ended as NSE chief on July 16. The appointment is subject to Chauhan accepting the offer.

157.title: India reports 16,935 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 1,44,264
157.article_body: India has reported 16,935 COVID-19 cases and 51 related deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 20,528 COVID-19 cases. The number of active coronavirus cases in India stand at 1,44,264, according to the latest data.

158.title: Pune jewellery store to give 'commitment rings' to 7,500 soldiers
158.article_body: A Pune jewellery store has launched 'EkIndia Mission' to mark 75 years of independence. As part of the mission, 7,500 soldiers will be given 'commitment rings'. These rings would be made of silver, gold, diamond, and soil from different states. "The ring is made of silver with 'Bharat' written on it," Sanket B Biyani, one of partners of store said.

159.title: Delhi's NSD to get a new building; work may start in 6 months
159.article_body: The National School of Drama in Delhi is all set to get a new building for which the construction work is likely to begin in six months. "The design for the new building will be finalised by July-end," an official said. Despite ₹180 crore being sanctioned in 2016 for the revamp, the work got delayed due to multiple reasons.

160.title: 'I am in, when do I start?' Ryan Gosling on working in Indian films
160.article_body: Hollywood actor Ryan Gosling, during an interview, was asked if he wanted to feature in an Indian film. To this, the actor replied, "I would love that. I really would. If you can hook me up, let me know. I am in, when do I start?" Actor Dhanush will be seen alongside Ryan and Chris Evans in 'The Gray Man'.

161.title: I saw Highway & was like 'she turned out to be like Big B': Ranbir on Alia
161.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor said that when he saw wife Alia Bhatt's movie 'Highway', he thought that she turned out to be like actor Amitabh Bachchan. "When I saw Highway and all, I came to Ayan's house only...But if I say such nice things about my wife now, then people won't take it seriously," he added.

162.title: Original BJP isn't running Karnataka govt, says DK Shivakumar
162.article_body: Karnataka Congress leader DK Shivakumar on Sunday said it's a coalition government in state and it's not being run by those from the “original BJP”. "It’s a government of all party MLAs," he added. "There's fear in BJP that there are a lot of internal problems. That’s the reason their national leaders are repeatedly coming and holding discussions," Shivakumar stated.

163.title: It was easy to identify him: Mufti after her sister identifies Yasin as her kidnapper
163.article_body: After Rubaiya Sayeed, sister of PDP chief Mehbooba Mufti, identified Kashmiri separatist leader Yasin Malik as one of her kidnappers, Mufti said he had been in public domain and it was easy to identify him. "Rubaiya was called as witness to identify someone…32 years is long time, people forget a lot of things. She couldn't identify anyone else," Mufti added.

164.title: Bird found mid-air in cockpit of Air India Express' Bahrain-Kochi flight
164.article_body: An alive bird was found in the cockpit of the Air India Express' Bahrain-Kochi flight on July 15 while it was mid-air. The bird was discovered in the glove box on the co-pilot's side of the aircraft when it was at a height of 37,000 feet. While the flight landed safely in Kochi, the DGCA is investigating the incident.

165.title: Class 10 student scared of exam result tweets to Mumbai Police, gets response
165.article_body: Ahead of the ICSE Class 10 board results declaration, a Maharashtra-based student took to Twitter and tagged Mumbai and Maharashtra Police saying, "Today is my ICSE results and I am really scared." Responding to his tweet, the Mumbai Police said, "Don't worry about your results. Exam is a journey. It is not just a final destination or an achievement."

166.title: I knew I had to step up: Hardik on his 4/24 in 3rd ODI against England
166.article_body: Team India all-rounder Hardik Pandya said he knew he had to "step up" with the ball in the final ODI against England after Jasprit Bumrah was ruled out of the game. "I was told I might...bowl in death overs and those are big shoes to fill...I knew I had to step up," he stated. Hardik registered bowling figures of 7-3-24-4.

167.title: Hero Vired’s Management program offers campus immersion at INSEAD France
167.article_body: Hero Vired and INSEAD, the world's leading management institute, have jointly designed a 6-month online program on Strategic Management & Business Essentials which includes a 5-day on-campus immersion in France where students can attend live lectures by the INSEAD faculty. The program caters to professionals, entrepreneurs, & senior leaders looking to upgrade their leadership skills, it stated

168.title: 'Job mela' with over 70 companies to be held in Hyderabad on July 27
168.article_body: A 'job mela' will be organised in Hyderabad's Nampally by an organisation called Deccan blasters on July 27 from 9 am to 2 pm. Over 70 companies will take part in this 'mela' to fill up over 5,000 vacancies. "So far, we have conducted 24 job melas...and more than 4,000 candidates were selected," Deccans Blaster's chairman said.

169.title: Gunman opens fire inside US mall killing 3 people; civilian shoots him dead
169.article_body: Three people were killed and another two were injured at Greenwood Park Mall in the US state of Indiana after a man with a rifle opened fire in a food court, officials said. An armed civilian killed the man, Greenwood Police Department Chief said. Police have confiscated a suspicious backpack that was in a bathroom near the food court.

170.title: Rishabh Pant gifts his Man of the Match champagne to Ravi Shastri, video goes viral
170.article_body: India wicketkeeper Rishabh Pant gifted his Man of the Match champagne to ex-India head coach Ravi Shastri after India defeated England in the ODI series decider on Sunday. A video has gone viral showing Pant going towards Shastri and handing him the bottle, with crowd cheering in the background. Pant scored 125*(113) to win the Man of the Match award.

171.title: R Madhavan shares video of his son Vedaant breaking national junior record in swimming
171.article_body: Actor R Madhavan took to Twitter to share a video of his 16-year-old son Vedaant breaking the national junior record in 1,500m freestyle swimming in Boys Group 1 category. "Never say never," R Madhavan wrote alongside the video. "Nothing is as wonderful for a father as seeing his child's success," a Twitter user commented on Madhavan's post.

172.title: State of emergency declared by Sri Lanka's acting President
172.article_body: Acting Sri Lankan President Ranil Wickremesinghe has declared a state of emergency in the country. "It is expedient, so to do, in the interests of public security, the protection of public order and the maintenance of supplies and services essential to the life of the community," the notice stated. Last week the emergency was declared after President Gotabaya Rajapaksa's escape.

173.title: Vedaant Madhavan, son of actor R Madhavan, breaks national junior swimming record
173.article_body: Maharashtra's 16-year-old swimmer Vedaant Madhavan, who's the son of actor R Madhavan, broke the national junior record in 1,500m freestyle in Boys Group 1 category. Vedaant clocked 16:01.73 at 48th Junior National Aquatic Championships 2022 to win gold medal and set the record. The previous record was held by Madhya Pradesh swimmer Advait Page, who had clocked 16:06.43 in 2017.

174.title: Jennifer Lopez and Ben Affleck get married in Las Vegas; pics released
174.article_body: Hollywood stars Jennifer Lopez and Ben Affleck got married in a late-night Las Vegas drive-through chapel. Jennifer announced their marriage in her newsletter with the heading "We did it". "Love is beautiful. Love is kind. And it turns out love is patient. Twenty years patient," she wrote in a message signed Jennifer Lynn Affleck.

175.title: We have the technical capability to build a nuclear bomb: Iran
175.article_body: Iranian Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei's senior advisor Kamal Kharrazi on Sunday told Al Jazeera that the country has the technical capability to build a nuclear bomb but has not decided whether to build one yet. This comes after US President Joe Biden pledged to stop Iran from "acquiring a nuclear weapon".

176.title: NATO's refusal to recognise Crimea as Russian is a threat: Medvedev
176.article_body: Deputy Chairman of the Russian Security Council Dmitry Medvedev on Sunday said that NATO and Ukraine's refusal to recognise Crimea as a part of Russia is a "systemic threat" to Russia.
