This comes a day after a Ukrainian official suggested that Crimea could come under bombardment by US-made HIMARS missiles deployed by Ukraine to counter Russian forces.

177.title: Jawans help woman deliver baby on river bank in Chhattisgarh
177.article_body: A tribal woman delivered a baby on a river bank with the help of Home Guard jawans in Chhattisgarh's rain-hit Bijapur district, police said. The woman needed to cross a river to reach the sub-health centre. However, she went into labour just before being shifted on the rescue boat and gave birth along the river with help from the jawans.

178.title: Scindia meets Aviation Ministry officials, DGCA over safety issues
178.article_body: Civil Aviation Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia chaired a meeting with the ministry's senior officials and the regulator of the Directorate General of Civil Aviation, an official said. The meeting was held to discuss safety issues reported to the ministry in the last few weeks. Scindia told the officials that the safety of passengers is paramount and to ensure it's not compromised.

179.title: BigBasket's losses jumps four times in FY22 as employee costs soar
179.article_body: According to its latest filings with the Ministry of Corporate Affairs, BigBasket's Business to Consumer (B2C) arm reported that its net loss widened fourfold to ₹812.7 crore in FY22 from ₹202.7 crore in FY21. The Tata Digital-owned firm's employee expenses increased to ₹739 crore from ₹236 crore in FY21. The company's other expenditures such as advertising and transportation also doubled.

180.title: Police bust illegal casino in Meerut, arrest 43
180.article_body: In Meerut's Partapur area, 43 people were arrested after an illegal casino was busted, the police said. The police conducted a raid at the Octri Marriage Home on the basis of a tip-off and also seized ₹6 lakh in cash, Senior Superintendent of Police (SSP) Rohit Singh Sajwan said. Those arrested are being produced in court, he added.

181.title: French public figures accuse new minister of homophobic comments
181.article_body: Over 100 French figures have signed open letter denouncing minister Caroline Cayeux for making homophobic remarks. Cayeux, who was appointed minister for territorial cohesion as part of France's new government on July 4, had termed France's plans to legalise gay marriage in 2013 as a "caprice" that goes "against nature". While she initially defended those remarks, she has since apologised.

182.title: Thank MP residents for reposing trust in BJP: PM on civic poll results
182.article_body: Congratulating winners of civic polls in MP, PM Narendra Modi on Sunday thanked the state's residents for "reposing their trust in BJP". "This victory is a symbol of the unwavering faith of the people in CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan's government," PM tweeted. BJP has won 7 mayoral seats, Congress has won 3 mayoral seats and AAP has bagged 1 seat.

183.title: Iran sanctions 61 US citizens for backing dissident group
183.article_body: Iran has imposed sanctions against 61 US citizens for extending support to an exiled dissident group Mujahideen-e-Khalq, Tehran announced on Saturday. According to Iranian state media, the sanctioned individuals include former US President Donald Trump's personal attorney Rudy Giuliani, former US Secretary of State Mike Pompeo and former White House National Security Adviser John Bolton.

184.title: Noodle-like object spotted on Mars, NASA releases pic
184.article_body: NASA's Perseverance rover spotted a string-like material that resembles a swirl of noodles. Sharing a picture, NASA said that the rover acquired the image of the area in front of it using its onboard Front Right Hazard Avoidance Camera A. The exact nature of the object is not known yet, with experts estimating that it could be debris.

185.title: 19-yr-old climbs electric tower as 15-yr-old girlfriend refuses to marry him in TN
185.article_body: A 19-year-old in Chennai climbed a high-tension electric tower, triggering a power cut in the area and affecting suburban train services there. The youth climbed the tower after his 15-year-old girlfriend refused to marry him. The girl had to be brought to the spot to convince him to climb down after the police, fire department and rescue team failed.

186.title: Remember no freebies to big producers, people watch you not them: Lalit Modi to Ranveer
186.article_body: Ex-IPL Chairman Lalit Modi took to Twitter to share a news article about Ranveer Singh's reaction to his and Sushmita's dating news. Lalit wrote, "Thank you for your kind wishes." He added, "I'm sorry no IPL now...But as I said take...time out and do what you desire...Remember (laughing and cash emojis) no freebies to big producers...People watch you not them."

187.title: I competed vs 3 of the greatest players: Hewitt on Federer, Nadal, Djokovic
187.article_body: After being inducted into the International Tennis Hall of Fame on Sunday, a ceremony delayed from 2021 by COVID-19, ex-world number one Lleyton Hewitt said he feels fortunate to have played across different generations. He added that he competed against three of the greatest tennis players the sport has ever seen in Roger Federer, Rafael Nadal and Novak Djokovic.

188.title: Novak Djokovic likes Kevin Pietersen's social media post in support of Virat Kohli
188.article_body: Twenty one-time Grand Slam champion Novak Djokovic reacted to ex-England captain Kevin Pietersen's social media post in support of Virat Kohli. Djokovic liked the post on Instagram wherein Pietersen urged Kohli to be proud, walk tall and enjoy life. "There's way more than just the bubble of cricket out there. You'll be back, @virat.kohli," Pietersen had written in the post.

189.title: Supreme Court bench headed by CJI to hear pleas on Maha crisis on July 20
189.article_body: A Supreme Court bench headed by Chief Justice NV Ramana will on July 20 hear a batch of petitions related to the recent political crisis in Maharashtra. Both Uddhav Thackeray-led Shiv Sena and the faction led by CM Eknath Shinde have moved the court over the disqualification of MLAs. Meanwhile, Sanjay Raut demanded the imposition of President's rule in Maharashtra.

190.title: Dust storm causes massive 21-vehicle pileup in US; 2 children among 6 killed
190.article_body: A dust storm caused a pileup of 21 vehicles in US' Montana, killing six people, including two children. The storm reduced visibility to zero causing the "mass casualty crash" on the Interstate 90 highway near Hardin on Friday. Winds with speeds of around 60 mph were recorded around the time of the pile-up, reports said.

191.title: Tola wins men's marathon with championship record at World Athletics C'ships
191.article_body: Ethiopia's Tamirat Tola won a gold medal in the men's marathon at World Athletics Championships with a championship record on Sunday. He won the race in two hours 05.36 minutes. Compatriot Mosinet Geremew won a second successive silver, clocking 2:06.44, while Belgium's Somalia-born Bashir Abdi won bronze with a timing of 2:06.48.

192.title: Corporate funding in global solar sector down 11%: Mercom Capital
192.article_body: Corporate funding in global solar sector has declined 11% to $12 billion in first half of 2022 against $13.5 billion in the same period last year, a Mercom Capital report stated. In H1 2022, venture capital funding activity increased 125% to $3.7 billion across 53 deals. In the same time period, solar public market financing fell 10% to $3.3 billion.

193.title: Sri Lanka lowers fuel prices for the 1st time since Feb amid crisis
193.article_body: Sri Lanka on Sunday lowered its fuel prices for the first time since February of this year amid the country's ongoing economic crisis. Prices of petrol and diesel were lowered by LKR 20 each, which were previously priced at LKR 470/litre and LKR 460/litre respectively. Notably, the cash-strapped country has introduced a fuel rationing scheme this month.

194.title: Rishabh Pant smashes his 1st ever ODI hundred as India win series against England
194.article_body: Rishabh Pant smashed his first-ever hundred in ODI cricket as India defeated England by five wickets in the third ODI in Manchester to win the three-match series 2-1. Pant became the second designated Indian wicketkeeper after Rahul Dravid to smash an ODI hundred in England. India have now won eight consecutive international series under Rohit Sharma's captaincy.

195.title: Aiming to reduce Infant Mortality Rate in Karnataka: CM Bommai
195.article_body: Karnataka's Infant Mortality Rate (IMR) is 20 per 1000 live births and CM Basavaraj Bommai said that the aim is to reduce it to single digits. He also emphasised reducing the Maternal Mortality Rate (MMR). While IMR and MMR have reduced in the state, special focus is being given to 5-6 districts where the rate is high, he said.

196.title: Maharashtra reported 104 rain-related deaths since June 1
196.article_body: Maharashtra has reported 104 rain-related deaths since the onset of the monsoons on June 1, according to a report by the state disaster management authority. The fatalities have been recorded between June 1-July 16 with two deaths being reported in the last 24 hours. As per the report, rain-related incidents include floods, lightning strikes, landslides, collapse of structures, among others.

197.title: Guinea's military names acting PM during absence of Beavogui
197.article_body: Guinea's military junta appointed Commerce and Industry Minister Bernard Gomou to take over as acting PM in the absence of PM Mohamed Beavogui, state media reported on Saturday. No information regarding the period of the absence or the reason behind it was provided. Beavogui was appointed PM last October to oversee the transition to democracy, following a coup in September.

198.title: Afghan Interior Minister urges US to unfreeze country's $7bn funds
198.article_body: Afghanistan's acting Interior Minister Sirajuddin Haqqani has reportedly criticised the US for freezing Afghanistan's funds worth $7 billion and urged it to release the assets. Addressing a gathering in Khost province, Haqqani said that the formation of an inclusive government will automatically take place when "the western ideology" is eliminated from Afghanistan, local media reported.

199.title: UAE sentences lawyer, who represented Khashoggi, to 3 yrs in jail
199.article_body: The UAE has sentenced a US citizen and the former lawyer of slain Saudi journalist Jamal Khashoggi to three years in prison on charges of money laundering and tax evasion. The accused, Asim Ghafoor, has also been ordered to pay a fine of $816,748. The UAE termed Ghafoor's sentencing a coordinated move with the US to "combat transnational crimes".

200.title: Pak to get $4 bn from friendly countries amid forex crisis: Minister
200.article_body: Pakistan will likely receive $4 billion from friendly countries this month to bridge gap in its forex reserves highlighted by the International Monetary Fund (IMF), Finance Minister Miftah Ismail said. The country will receive the amount in form of deposits and investments, he added. Ismail's comments come as IMF reached a staff-level agreement with Pakistan for disbursal of $1.17 billion.

201.title: Arrests will be made for seeking rights in new India: Rahul Gandhi
201.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Sunday criticised the government over unemployment and action against protesting youths, saying "arrests will be made for seeking rights in new India". "Don't ask questions. Don't raise your voice. Don't protest peacefully," he said. By shattering the hopes of crores of families, this dictatorial government is destroying the future of the country, Gandhi added.

202.title: India moved from cooperative federalism to coercive unilateralism: Sibal
202.article_body: Rajya Sabha MP and former Congress leader Kapil Sibal said that the country has "moved from cooperative federalism to coercive unilateralism". He further added that the politics of the central government is ruling every state instead of the Constitution. Addressing a federalism seminar, Sibal said BJP-led Centre's motive is to create 'opposition-mukt Bharat' (opposition-free India).

203.title: Tribal council in Pak prohibits women from visiting tourist spots
203.article_body: An all-male tribal council in Pakistan's Bajaur tribal district on Saturday issued a diktat barring women from visiting tourist spots, saying that the practice is "unethical" and against Islamic principles. The council further warned the government that failure to enforce the ban by Sunday would prompt the council members to take matters into their own hands, local media reported.

204.title: ED's conviction rate 0.5%, only used to target Opp'n: AAP MP
204.article_body: AAP Rajya Sabha MP Sanjay Singh on Sunday accused the Central government of misusing the investigative agencies for targeting Opposition leaders in the country, adding that the conviction rate of ED is only 0.5%. He also alleged that the Punjab government is being forced to buy Adani coal at ₹30,000, which is ten times more than India coal.

205.title: Private schools in Tamil Nadu to remain closed tomorrow over Kallakurichi violence
205.article_body: The Tamil Nadu Private School Association president said all private nursery, matriculation and CBSE schools in the state will remain closed on Monday to protest against the attack on a school in Kallakurichi, where a girl died by suicide. Meanwhile, the Directorate of Matriculation said there's no prior permission for a strike. People protesting over the incident torched school buses.

206.title: 32 bills indicated by various departments for Monsoon session, 14 ready: Govt
206.article_body: The government said that 32 bills have been indicated by various departments for presentation in the Monsoon session of Parliament of which 14 are ready. The Monsoon session will commence on July 18 and is scheduled to continue till August 12. Parliamentary Affairs Minister Pralhad Joshi said some of these bills have already been discussed by standing committees of Parliament.

207.title: 30-yr-old sexually assaults minor for 5 yrs in Raj, gets life term
207.article_body: A POCSO court in Rajasthan's Bundi on Saturday convicted a 30-year-old doctor to life imprisonment for sexually assaulting a minor girl for five years. A case was registered against the accused in 2018, said Special Public Prosecutor Rakesh Thakur. When the minor moved to Kota to study, the accused would also reach there and rape her, he said.

208.title: Worker seen carrying PM Modi, UP CM's photos in garbage cart fired; video surfaces
208.article_body: A contractual worker in UP's Mathura Nagar Nigam was fired after he carried pictures of PM Narendra Modi and CM Yogi Adityanath, among other dignitaries in his garbage cart. A video of him carrying the photos in the cart has also been widely shared online. In the video, the man said he simply found the pictures lying in the garbage.

209.title: 4-month-old baby boy dies after being thrown off roof of a 3-storey house in UP
209.article_body: A four-month-old baby boy died after being thrown off the roof of a three-storey house by a monkey in Uttar Pradesh's Bareilly district, an official said. Bareilly Chief Conservator of Forests Lalit Verma said that the incident has been reported and a team of the forest department has been sent to conduct an investigation.

210.title: S Lanka in devastating state due to ill-advised steps: Oppn leader
210.article_body: Sri Lankan Opposition leader Sajith Premadasa said on Sunday that the country is in a "devastated state due" to "ill-advised economic steps". For three years, we have been telling the government to not proceed with such measures but they never listened, he added. Premadasa, along with three other leaders, will contest the upcoming Sri Lankan Presidential elections on July 20.

211.title: CFI organises conference in support of hijab in M'luru, hundreds attend
211.article_body: The Campus Front of India (CFI) organised a conference in support of students being allowed to wear hijab in Karnataka's Mangaluru on Saturday. The conference was attended by hundreds who also chanted slogans like 'Inquilab Zindabad' and 'Hijab is our right'. A skit was performed against Udupi BJP MLA Raghupathi Bhat for his statements against wearing hijab in educational institutes.

212.title: Stop SpiceJet operations: Plea in Delhi HC amid several malfunctions
212.article_body: A PIL has been filed in the Delhi High Court seeking direction to the Centre to stop the operation of SpiceJet Airlines in the wake of several incidents of technical glitches reported recently. The petitioner also sought direction to compensate the fair charges to passengers who have faced the threat to their life. The petition will be heard on Monday.

213.title: Bumrah wasn't there today but Hardik stepped in and how: Jaffer on 3rd ODI
213.article_body: After India bowled out England for 259 in 45.5 overs in third ODI at Old Trafford, Wasim Jaffer said, "Can't remember last time England were so tied down in a home series." He added, "Boom [Jasprit Bumrah] wasn't there today but Hardik Pandya stepped [in] and how." All-rounder Hardik posted 4/24 in seven overs, his best-ever bowling figures in ODIs.

214.title: I still haven't given up on US Open: Zverev on recovering after ankle surgery
214.article_body: World number two Alexander Zverev, who is undergoing rehab after having surgery on his right ankle, said he still hasn't given up on playing at US Open, beginning August 29. "And, of course, I want to be part of...Davis Cup for myself," he added. Zverev had twisted his ankle in French Open semi-final against Rafael Nadal on June 3.

215.title: INS Sindhudhvaj decommissioned after 35 years of service to nation
215.article_body: The Indian Navy decommissioned INS Sindhudhvaj on Saturday after serving the nation for 35 years. The ceremony was held at the Naval Dockyard in Visakhapatnam and was attended by 15 former commanding officers and 26 commissioning crew. Sindhudhvaj was the flag bearer of indigenisation and the Indian Navy's efforts towards achieving Atmanirbharta amid the Russian-built Sindhughosh-class submarines.

216.title: List shows fewest runs scored by Virat Kohli in bilateral series in ODI cricket
216.article_body: Virat Kohli on Sunday got out for 17 runs in the third ODI against England, aggregating 33 runs in the series. Kohli's fewest runs in a bilateral ODI series had come against Pakistan in 2012-2013, when he scored 13 runs in three innings. It is followed by 26 runs in three innings against West Indies earlier this year.

217.title: Which are the worst countries to move to as per latest global survey?
217.article_body: As per the latest Expat Insider ranking of 52 countries, Kuwait is considered the worst country for expats with New Zealand occupying the second-to-last spot. Hong Kong, Cyprus, Luxembourg, Japan, South Africa, Turkey, Italy and Malta have also been named among the least favoured countries by expats. Kuwait scored poorly in quality of life and ease of settling indices.

218.title: Impose Prez rule in Maharashtra till SC order on rebel MPs: Raut
218.article_body: Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut has demanded the imposition of the President's rule in Maharashtra till the constitution bench of the Supreme Court gives its verdict on the plea seeking disqualification of rebel MLAs. "Maharashtra's 12-crore population has a cabinet of 2 members that is taking arbitrary decisions. Where is the regard for the constitution?" he tweeted.

219.title: SP politician's killer on run since 2005 arrested from MP
219.article_body: A key accused in the killing of a Samajwadi Party leader in UP's Kaushambi has been arrested from MP, after being on the run for nearly two decades, police officials said on Sunday. The accused kept changing his location from Bihar to Maharashtra before settling in MP, officials said. He had changed his identity, said DSP (Prayagraj STF) Navendu Kumar.

220.title: Road built 1 month ago caves in after rainfall in Ahmedabad, video surfaces
220.article_body: A road built nearly one month ago near Surabhi Park in Gujarat's Ahmedabad caved in after a couple of hours of rainfall on Sunday. A video of the incident that has surfaced on social media shows a big portion of the road getting washed away. Traffic along the route has been affected after the incident.

221.title: Hardik Pandya records his best-ever bowling figures in ODI cricket
221.article_body: Team India all-rounder Hardik Pandya on Sunday recorded his best-ever bowling figures in ODI cricket. The 28-year-old registered bowling figures of 7-3-24-4 in the third ODI against England at Old Trafford in Manchester. Notably, Pandya's best bowling figures in Test cricket (6-1-28-5) and T20I cricket (4-0-33-4) had also come in England.

222.title: Virat Kohli gives tips to Siraj, he dismisses Root for duck next ball; video goes viral
222.article_body: A video has gone viral on social media showing fast bowler Mohammed Siraj dismissing England's Joe Root for a duck a ball after being given tips by Virat Kohli. Root got out for a three-ball duck. Earlier in that over, Siraj dismissed Jonny Bairstow for a three-ball duck. Siraj finished with figures of 9-1-66-2 in the innings.

223.title: We take measures whenever Chinese aircraft comes near LAC: IAF chief
223.article_body: Air Chief Marshal Vivek Ram Chaudhari has said that air activity across Line of Actual Control (LAC) is continuously monitored, adding that IAF takes "appropriate measures" whenever any Chinese aircraft is detected near LAC. His comments come as Chinese aircraft had reportedly breached LAC briefly last month. Notably, 16th high-level military talks between India and China were held on Sunday.

224.title: Latest ranking of world's top 10 countries for expats released
224.article_body: The Expat Insider Rankings for 2022 have been released with Mexico securing the top spot and Indonesia occupying the second position. Taiwan, Portugal, Spain, UAE, Vietnam, Thailand, Australia and Singapore are also among the top 10 countries to move to. India has been ranked 36 out of the 52 countries on the list, with a high affordability score.

225.title: Your attitude to win inspires everyone: Sachin on Sindhu's Singapore Open win
225.article_body: Taking to Twitter to congratulate PV Sindhu after she won the Singapore Open title, Sachin Tendulkar wrote, "Your [Sindhu's] attitude and spirit to win every game is something that inspires everyone!" He added, "Many more to follow." Sindhu defeated China's Wang Zhi Yi 21-9, 11-21, 21-15 in the final to clinch her third title of the year.

226.title: Always preferred diamonds, I still buy them myself: Sushmita on being called gold digger
226.article_body: Reacting to being called a gold digger for dating Lalit Modi, Sushmita Sen penned a post on Instagram. She wrote, "I dig deeper than gold...and I've always (famously) preferred diamonds! And yes I still buy them myself!" "It's heartbreaking to see just how miserable & unhappy the world around us is becoming," she wrote in the post.

227.title: India's Anjum Moudgil wins bronze in Changwon Shooting World Cup
227.article_body: India's Anjum Moudgil won a bronze medal in 50m Rifle 3 Positions Women at ISSF Shooting World Cup in Changwon, South Korea on Sunday. Anjum shot 402.9 in the final round to finish third. This is the 28-year-old's second straight individual World Cup medal of 2022. Anjum had won silver in the same event at Baku World Cup last month.

228.title: Bengaluru reports 6 murders, including that of 2 women, in 3 days
228.article_body: Bengaluru reported six murders, including that of two women, since Friday. In Anekal, a man allegedly killed his 25-year-old wife over suspected infidelity, police said, adding that he has been arrested. A 57-year-old woman was murdered when she was alone at home on Friday and jewellery and about ₹3 lakh in cash were also reported missing.

229.title: BJP wins 4 seats, AAP wins 1 in Madhya Pradesh mayoral polls
229.article_body: BJP has won mayoral seats in Burhanpur, Satna, Khandwa and Sagar, while AAP's Rani Agrawal has won the mayoral post in Singrauli in the party's civic poll debut in the state. Congress has won in Chhindwara. The elections in the first phase were held for 133 civic bodies, including 11 municipal corporations and 36 councils, on July 6.

230.title: The terms I have coined are now part of pop culture: Kangana
230.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut stated in an interview that her interviews, quotes and terms she has coined are now a part of pop culture. The actress added that she believes she knows the pulse of the audience. "I do believe that the audience is looking for something which will stimulate their intellectual side and not just their sensual side," she said.

231.title: CRPF personnel killed in terrorist attack in J&K's Pulwama
231.article_body: A CRPF officer was killed on Sunday afternoon after terrorists ambushed security forces deployed at a checkpoint in J&K's Pulwama, Kashmir Police said. According to police, ASI Vinod Kumar was rushed to a hospital where he succumbed to his injuries during treatment. The area has been cordoned off and a search operation is underway, police added.

232.title: 'Namma Clinics' to be launched in 243 B'luru wards from next month
232.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai said on Sunday that 'Namma Clinics' will be launched in 243 wards of Bengaluru from next month onwards. The clinics will provide services for the detection of non-communicable diseases and referral for higher treatment to specialists, CM Bommai had earlier said. The clinics will reportedly each have a medical officer, a staff nurse and two assistants.

233.title: Quite a bit of my brain is missing: GoT actress Emilia on suffering 2 brain haemorrhages
233.article_body: Opening up about suffering two brain haemorrhages in 2011 and 2013, Game of Thrones (GoT) actress Emilia Clarke said, "There’s quite a bit [of my brain] missing!" She added, "The amount of my brain that is no longer usable...It’s remarkable that I am able to speak, sometimes articulately, and live my life completely normally with absolutely no repercussions."

234.title: Explosions heard for 2 hrs as plane with 12 tons of mines & weapons crashes in Greece
234.article_body: A plane carrying 12 tons of munitions including mines crashed in Greece on Saturday night, triggering explosions that were heard for two hours. All eight crew members of the plane, that was going from Serbia to Bangladesh, were killed. A fireball was also seen by local residents at the crash site that's being combed for remaining explosive cargo and chemicals.

235.title: Over 75 home buyers cheated of ₹15 cr by builder: Gurugram Police
235.article_body: Over 75 home buyers were allegedly cheated of ₹15 crore by a real estate firm on the assurance of providing flats, Gurugram Police said. Savyasachi Infrastructure Private Limited had taken money from the victims with the assurance that their flats would be ready within a year, but work is yet to begin even after four years, police said.

236.title: Over 50,000 challans issued in 4 months for improper parking in Delhi
236.article_body: As many as 545 vehicles were towed in Delhi in the last four months for improperly parking in bus lanes, Delhi Transport Minister Kailash Gahlot said. During this period, over 50,000 no-parking challans were issued against violators, while 1,810 challans were issued against bus drivers. Nearly 90% of buses now drive in their designated bus lanes, the ministry said.

237.title: 23-year-old shot man dead by his friend over argument in Delhi
237.article_body: A 23-year-old man was shot dead by his friend in Delhi's Azadpur on the intervening night of Saturday and Sunday following an argument, police said. The victim's body was found by patrol vehicles near the Ramleela Ground in Azadpur. He was taken to the Babu Jagjivan Ram Memorial Hospital where he was declared brought dead.

238.title: Funding in Indian startups dropped to $6 billion in April-June: Nasscom
238.article_body: According to industry body, Nasscom, funding in Indian startups dropped 17% to $6 billion in the April-June quarter. According to the quarterly investment factbook, in collaboration with PGA Labs, deals also dropped 17% due to dampened market sentiment while funding increased. With four new unicorns, the total number of unicorns in the first half of 2022 is now 20.

239.title: Master craftsman: Ian Bishop on Babar Azam's 7th Test ton in Galle
239.article_body: After Pakistan captain Babar Azam hit his seventh Test century in the side's first innings of first Test against Sri Lanka, Ian Bishop tweeted, "Master craftsman; Babar...superb once again." Babar scored 119 runs off 244 balls in Galle. The 27-year-old hit 11 fours and two sixes during his knock. Overall, it is Babar's 25th international century.

240.title: Bengaluru delivery boy was killed over street fight, not Urdu: CID
240.article_body: Bengaluru delivery boy Chandru V, who was murdered in April, was killed over a street altercation and not over the Urdu language, the Karnataka CID has said in its chargesheet. Earlier, Karnataka Home Minister Araga Jnanendra had claimed that the victim was killed for not knowing Urdu. He later withdrew his claim after a police fact-check discredited the angle.

241.title: Congress candidate dies of heart attack after losing municipal council polls in MP
241.article_body: A Congress candidate died due to a heart attack after he lost the municipal council election in Madhya Pradesh's Rewa on Sunday. The candidate, Harinarayan Gupta, had contested the elections from ward number nine in the Hanumana area. Independent candidate Akhilesh Gupta defeated him by 14 votes. Harinarayan was also the mandal president of the Congress unit in Hanumana.

242.title: AIUDF to support Yashwant Sinha in upcoming Presidential elections
242.article_body: The All India United Democratic Front (AIUDF) on Sunday said that it will vote for the Opposition's Presidential candidate Yashwant Sinha in upcoming elections. AIUDF leader Aminul Islam said that the party will back Sinha even as it was "sidelined" during Sinha's recent visit to Assam to seek support for his candidature. Presidential elections will be held on July 18.

243.title: Over 80 displaced animals, birds rescued amid heavy rains in Mumbai
243.article_body: Over 80 displaced animals and birds were rescued from various parts of Mumbai in the last few days amid heavy rains in the city. As many as seven turtles were found in different parts of the city, a forest official said. Over 35 snakes of different species were rescued from residential and commercial areas, the official said.

244.title: Garuda Aerospace drones being used in Gujarat, Andhra floods
244.article_body: Chennai-based startup Garuda Aerospace's drones, which were developed for Swiggy deliveries, were used in Gujarat and Andhra Pradesh to deliver food and medicines during the floods. Agnishwar Jayaprakash, Founder and CEO of Garuda Aerospace, said that to support NDRF officials, Garuda Aerospace teams were deployed in Vadodara and Guntur. Previously, the drones were used during the Assam floods.

245.title: Nepali couple among 3 arrested for stealing ₹1 cr valuables in Hyd
245.article_body: Hyderabad's Cyberabad Police has arrested a Nepali couple and their associate for allegedly stealing valuables worth ₹1 crore from the house of the couple's employer in Kukatpally. According to police, the accused husband and wife were living in a servant quarter. The robbery was committed while the employer and his family were away for a ceremony, police said.

246.title: Terrorism, cyber crime challenges before Mumbai Police: Commissioner
246.article_body: Mumbai Police Commissioner Vivek Phansalkar has said tackling terrorism and cyber crime are major challenges for the police, but efforts are on to keep the metropolis terror-free. "Safety of women and prevention of crime against them is our priority," Phansalkar said. Mumbai Police is also taking necessary steps to make police stations and security personnel child-friendly, he added.

247.title: Centre's observer reviews Prez poll preparation at T'gana Assembly in Hyd
247.article_body: Central government observer Krishna Kumar Dwivedi on Saturday reviewed preparations at the Telangana Legislative Assembly in Hyderabad for the presidential elections due on Monday. Dwivedi interacted with the assembly secretary, V Narsimha Charyulu and other officials. He was given a tour of the assembly premises and polling station.

248.title: Opp'n trying to belittle the image of Parliament: Union Minister
248.article_body: Union Minister Pralhad Joshi on Sunday criticised the Opposition, saying it was making issues out of non-issues and trying to belittle the image of Parliament. "No word has been barred from use in Parliament and the Lok Sabha Secretariat has been bringing out such a list of unparliamentary words since 1954," Joshi added.

249.title: Indian team is struggling because Kohli is not among the runs: Akmal
249.article_body: Pakistani cricketer Kamran Akmal said Team India is struggling because Virat Kohli is not among the runs, adding the side is heavily dependent on the batter. "He has single-handedly won so many games for India...when he comes out of the rut, India's performance will also improve," he further said. Kohli scored 16 in India's 100-run loss against England at Lord's.

250.title: Ex-K'taka minister influencing probe: Deceased contractor's wife
250.article_body: Deceased contractor Santosh Patil's wife, Jayashree Patil, has alleged that the main accused in her husband's suicide case, former Karnataka minister KS Eshwarappa, is influencing the police investigation in his favour. She has cited Eshwarappa's statement to substantiate her claim wherein he had purportedly said that he would be acquitted of the charges in 15 days.

251.title: Sushmita reacts to being called 'gold digger' for dating Lalit Modi, says she's self made
251.article_body: Actress Sushmita Sen took to Twitter to react to being called a 'gold digger' for dating ex-IPL Chairman Lalit Modi. Sushmita praised an article that called out trolls for attacking her over her relationship with Lalit. Alongside the article, she wrote, "A self made woman." "Ma'am these people (trolls) are just jealous souls," a Twitter user commented on Sushmita's post.

252.title: She yet again demonstrated her exceptional talent: PM on Sindhu winning Singapore Open
252.article_body: Congratulating PV Sindhu on winning her first-ever Singapore Open title, PM Narendra Modi tweeted, "She has yet again demonstrated her exceptional sporting talent and achieved success." He added, "It is a proud moment for the country and will also give inspiration to upcoming players." Notably, Sindhu has won three titles in 2022 so far.

253.title: Probe initiated to find how Delhi couple got away with 25 guns
253.article_body: Delhi customs has initiated an inquiry to find out how a married couple was successful in smuggling 25 guns into the country in December last year via the international airport. The guns were smuggled from Turkey. The couple was arrested recently for allegedly smuggling 45 guns, worth ₹22.5 lakh, into the country at the Indira Gandhi International (IGI) airport.

254.title: ICSE Class 10 results declared, 99.97% pass the exam
254.article_body: The Council for the Indian School Certificate Examinations (CISCE) has declared the results of the Class 10 board exams or ICSE exams. Four students have secured All India Rank 1 with 99.8% marks, while 34 students have secured the second rank with 99.6%, PTI reported. Pass percentage of students is 99.97%.

255.title: IAF to hold 2-day Avionics Indigenisation Seminar in Pune from Monday
255.article_body: The Indian Air Force (IAF) is going to host a two-day Avionics Indigenisation Seminar, AVISEM-22, in Pune from Monday. The theme of the seminar will be 'Indigenisation of Avionics Aggregates Based on Modular Open System Architecture Framework'. The objective is to evolve a strategy to reduce the dependence on foreign manufacturers for the supply and maintenance of avionics, IAF said.

256.title: Have received 7.5 lakh Agnipath applications; youths are keen: IAF chief
256.article_body: IAF chief, Air Chief Marshal VR Chaudhari, has said that the force has received 7.5 lakh applications under the Agnipath scheme. "This shows the keenness of the youth to join the armed forces. The big challenge lies in finishing the selection process on time to start training in December," Chaudhari said. Notably, the Agnipath scheme had sparked protests across India.

257.title: 15 staff suspended, 35 transferred in Bengaluru's Central Prison
257.article_body: The government suspended 15 officials attached to Bengaluru's Central Prison and transferred 35 to other jails for dereliction of duty. Karnataka Home Minister Araga Jnanendra said the officials were allowing prisoners special treatment including the use of mobile phones and drugs inside the jail. The move comes after the first meeting of the newly formed Karnataka State Prison Development Board.

258.title: 4 Pune dams now have enough water to meet city's yearly requirement
258.article_body: The collective water stock in four dams that supply drinking water to Pune has increased to 16 TMC amid rains, which is equivalent to the city's yearly requirement. The dams of Panshet, Varasgaon, Temghar and Khadakwasla now hold over 50% water of their collective water storage capacity. Meanwhile, IMD has issued a yellow alert for Pune till July 18.

259.title: Whenever Jagdeep Dhankhar takes up task he completes it: Brother Randeep
259.article_body: NDA's Vice-President candidate Jagdeep Dhankhar's brother, Randeep, has commented on his brother's abilities. "We had not expected this. When he became the West Bengal Governor, we did not know even then," Randeep said. He added, "Whenever my brother takes any task into his hands, he works hard to complete it. When he did advocacy...his clients used to get positive results."

260.title: Centre summons all-party meeting on Sri Lanka crisis on July 19
260.article_body: Centre has summoned an all-party meeting to discuss ongoing crisis in Sri Lanka on Tuesday, the second day of Monsoon session of Parliament. The meeting will be briefed by Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman and External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar. This comes as both DMK and AIADMK sought India's intervention on issue, especially to address concerns regarding Sri Lanka's Tamil population.

261.title: Rajamouli wanted to direct 'Bajrangi...', couldn't over 'Baahubali': Writer
261.article_body: 'Bajrangi Bhaijaan' writer KV Vijayendra Prasad revealed his son SS Rajamouli wanted to direct the Salman Khan-starrer. He said he narrated the story to Rajamouli who cried but asked him to give the film away. "Once the film...released, he...said, 'Papa...I was shooting the climax of 'Baahubali 1'...Had you asked me 10 days before or later, I'd have directed'," Prasad added.

262.title: Former UP MLC arrested in Mumbai by Saharanpur Police
262.article_body: A former member of the Uttar Pradesh Legislative Council, Mahmood Ali, was arrested in Mumbai by the Saharanpur Police. Ali is the brother of former MLC Haji Iqbal, who is allegedly a member of a mining mafia, police said. Iqbal's three sons are already arrested in various cases. Notably, Iqbal and Ali were BSP MLCs from 2010-2016 and 2016-2022 respectively.

263.title: B'luru Police arrests 3 individuals with drugs worth ₹90 lakh
263.article_body: Bengaluru Police has arrested three individuals, including two women, who were involved in the illicit drugs trade, a senior official said on Saturday. Drugs like hashish oil and ganja have been recovered from their possession, the official added. The seized items have an approximate value of ₹90 lakh, the official said.

264.title: Margaret Alva named Opposition's candidate for post of Vice President of India
264.article_body: NCP chief Sharad Pawar announced that Congress leader Margaret Alva is Opposition's candidate for the post of Vice President of India. Alva has earlier served as a Union Minister and has also served as Governor of several states including Gujarat and Goa. On Saturday, West Bengal Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar was announced as BJP-led NDA's candidate for Vice President post.

265.title: 'The Office' star Craig Robinson cancels show after gunman opens fire in US club
265.article_body: 'The Office' star Craig Robinson cancelled his show after a gunman opened fire at a comedy club in North Carolina, US, where the comedian was scheduled to perform. "I'm safe... It was wild. I was in the green room and they're like, 'Everybody get out!' It was a moment for sure," Robinson said in video posted on Instagram.

266.title: Possible candidate for next India captain: Saba Karim on Rishabh Pant
266.article_body: Praising Rishabh Pant, Saba Karim said the India wicketkeeper-batter is a special player and has match-winning abilities. "I believe that he can emerge as a big player for India in all three formats. Looking at his performances overseas...we can say that he's a possible candidate for...next captain," he added. Pant led India in T20I series against South Africa last month.

267.title: I was mistaken for Anil after 'JugJugg Jeeyo' screening: Sanjay
267.article_body: Actor Sanjay Kapoor revealed he was mistaken for his elder brother Anil Kapoor after the screening of 'JugJugg Jeeyo'. He said a fan told him he was fantastic in the film, adding that he told her, "Thank you...I'll convey it to my brother." "It used to happen a lot. People used to get confused between Anil and [me]," Sanjay said.

268.title: No dearth of selfish people among Dalits, marginalised: Mayawati
268.article_body: BSP chief Mayawati has alleged that there is no shortage of selfish people in Dalits and other neglected groups and has asked her party workers to beware of them. "There is no dearth of selfish people...some of them are even my family relatives," Mayawati tweeted. She added that these people have got several bogus social organisations registered.

269.title: B'luru Metro sees highest footfall in June 2022 since start of COVID-19
269.article_body: In June 2022, the Bengaluru Metro saw highest footfall since the COVID-19 pandemic began. On June 4, 5,07,450 people took the Namma Metro, which is highest figure after March 2020, according to Bengaluru Metro Rail Corporation Limited. On June 6, revenue of ₹1,29,82,164 was collected, which is said to be the highest daily revenue after the COVID-19 outbreak.

270.title: Govt ready to discuss any issue in Parliament: Pralhad Joshi
270.article_body: Ahead of the monsoon session of Parliament, Union Minister Pralhad Joshi on Sunday said the government is ready to discuss any issue, under rules and procedures of Parliament. "We invited 45 political parties of which 36 attended all-party meeting today, 36 leaders put forth their views, gave suggestions and demanded some issues to be discussed by government," he added.

271.title: Hyderabad man dies of electrocution while urinating near electric pole
271.article_body: A 40-year-old man died on Saturday due to electrocution while he was urinating near an electric pole in Saidabad's Dhobi Ghat area. The deceased, identified as Karim Bhai, was a truck driver from Gujarat and he had arrived in town to unload groceries at a business in Madannapet Mandi when the event occurred, as per reports.

272.title: Foreigners are creating cloudbursts in India: Telangana CM amid floods
272.article_body: Amid floods in parts of Telangana and other Indian states, Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao (KCR) said a "new phenomenon" called cloudburst is being noticed now. "Some are saying there are a few conspiracies involved. I don't know how much truth there is to it," said KCR. "Few people from other countries are doing cloudbursts in India," he added.

273.title: Losing in quarters or semis was upsetting, finally I got this win: Sindhu
273.article_body: Shuttler PV Sindhu has said winning the Singapore Open title, which is her third title victory of the year, "means a lot" to her. "Back then in a couple of tournaments, there were many hard-fought matches and losing in the quarter-finals or semi-finals was very upsetting...and I have finally got the win. I hope this tempo continues," stated Sindhu.

274.title: Such a threat: Bhogle on Siraj's double-wicket maiden over in 3rd England ODI
274.article_body: Team India pacer Mohammed Siraj bowled a double-wicket maiden over, dismissing Jonny Bairstow and Joe Root on ducks, in the ongoing third ODI against England at Old Trafford. Reacting to this, commentator Harsha Bhogle tweeted, "When Siraj takes the ball away, he becomes such a threat. I feared he was becoming a scrambled seam inward slant bowler. Excellent over."

275.title: Camaraderie with Rohit has been really good: Suryakumar
275.article_body: India batter Suryakumar Yadav said his camaraderie with skipper Rohit Sharma has been really good. "He's been watching me...talking to me since I played domestic cricket in Mumbai," he added. "I've really felt him on the ground whenever he's leading. I've learned a lot from him...happy that he has shown a lot of confidence in me," he further said.

276.title: Will see if unparliamentary words list imposed in draconian way: Tharoor
276.article_body: Amid the unparliamentary words row, Congress leader Shashi Tharoor said he would "speak normally" in the House and see whether the list of words is applied in a "draconian manner" to oppress meaningful criticism. A ruling by one presiding officer is not necessarily binding on another, so I would treat this list as indicative rather than definitive, he said.

277.title: Virat Kohli dances during warmup ahead of series decider, video goes viral
277.article_body: A video has gone viral on social media showing former Team India captain Virat Kohli dancing during warmup ahead of the ODI series decider against England in Manchester. "The most entertaining cricketer of recent times," a fan tweeted. "He knows how to absorb pressure," wrote another. India are bowling first in the series decider.

278.title: Shiv Sena will rejoice if Uddhav and Shinde reunite: Sanjay Raut
278.article_body: Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut on Sunday said that it will be a "happier moment" for the party if Uddhav Thackeray and Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde reunite. Marathi actress Deepali Sayed had previously expressed her happiness over the news of Uddhav and Shinde coming together for discussions keeping the sentiments of Shiv Sainiks in mind.

279.title: Centre declared this year’s floods in Assam as 'severe natural calamity': CM
279.article_body: The Centre has declared this year’s floods in Assam as a "severe natural calamity", CM Himanta Biswa Sarma said. "We had not witnessed a flood of this magnitude. Our priority was to evacuate affected people to relief camps, ensure their safety, provide medical aid and help them return home after the water receded. The task was challenging," CM added.

280.title: Bus carrying BMP jawans overturns as driver falls asleep, 23 jawans injured
280.article_body: A bus carrying Bihar Military Police (BMP) jawans overturned in Malaypur area of Bihar's Jamui on Sunday. 23 BMP jawans were injured in the incident. The bus reached Jamui as part of security arrangements for Chief Minister Nitish Kumar's programme on July 18. All injured jawans were moved to Sadar Hospital for treatment. Police said it appears driver fell asleep.

281.title: All Karnataka BJP MLAs moved to B'luru hotel ahead of Presidential election
281.article_body: All 121 Karnataka BJP MLAs have been shifted to a Bengaluru hotel ahead of the Presidential election on July 18. BJP chief whip M Satish Reddy has asked the MLAs to remain in the hotel until Monday morning. A BJP MLA said, "High command wants to send out a message of how serious our party is about Droupadi Murmu's candidature."

282.title: BJP nominated Dhankhar as VP candidate for political gains: Adhir Chowdhury
282.article_body: Congress leader Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury said that the BJP has nominated Jagdeep Dhankhar as their Vice Presidential candidate for political gains like for getting Jat votes as there are polls coming up in Rajasthan. We don't have any problem with his candidature, he added. BJP President JP Nadda announced Dhankhar's name as NDA's Vice President of India candidate on Saturday.

283.title: Mumbai man kills wife for not letting him sleep next to her
283.article_body: A 58-year-old man allegedly killed his wife by hitting her with a stone slab, after the latter didn't allow him to sleep next to her, in Mumbai's Malad area. The accused, Gyandev Ganpat Balade, was charged with a murder case after he surrendered himself to the police. The deceased's head was crushed entirely by the stone slab, police said.

284.title: Teen killed by 15 in emergency ward as hospital staff watch in Ludhiana
284.article_body: A 15-year-old boy was hacked to death by 15 people with swords and axes in the emergency ward of a civil hospital in Ludhiana on Thursday night. Two people have been arrested for the murder of the victim Savan Kumar. The incident was caught on CCTV showing hospital staff standing as the group killed the teen.

285.title: Robin Hood Army to complete serving 100 millionth meal soon
285.article_body: Robin Hood Army, a volunteer-based organization announced that it will complete serving the 100 millionth meal without raising a single rupee soon. The RHA, which is spread across 328 cities with 1,90,000+ Robins, revealed that it believes that everyone should be independent of hunger, which marks the base of their #Mission75 on the account of the 75th Independence Day.

286.title: Tourists fined ₹63,400 for flouting norms at Pune's Bhimashankar
286.article_body: Pune Rural Police have taken action against at least 18 tourists for flouting norms at Bhimashankar. The tourists were allegedly dancing to loud music on the road and didn't pay heed, after which, police seized their music systems and vehicles last week. The tourists, who comprised college students, were produced at a local court and fined ₹63,400.

287.title: There are songs in 'Brahmastra' that I've hidden away from Alia: Ayan
287.article_body: 'Brahmastra' director Ayan Mukerji revealed there are songs that he has "hidden away" from actress Alia Bhatt. During an Instagram Live session, a fan asked Ayan about the number of songs his film has. To this, he replied, "I wouldn't like to reveal this at this time actually...There are songs (in Brahmastra) that I have hidden away even from Alia."

288.title: BJP MLA's aide slaps toll staffer in Rajasthan, incident caught on camera
288.article_body: BJP MLA Sanjay Sharma's aide has been caught on camera slapping a toll plaza staffer in Rajasthan's Dausa. The incident occurred after the toll worker asked for the MLA's identity card which reportedly infuriated the aide. Sharma remained seated inside the car as his aide emerged from the car and threatened the staffer before slapping him.

289.title: When given responsibility, Hardik is a completely different cricketer: Shastri
289.article_body: Ex-Team India head coach Ravi Shastri has said Hardik Pandya is a completely different cricketer when given extra responsibilities. "He was picked by Gujarat Titans, where he was given the extra responsibility of captaining, which did him a world of good," added Shastri. Hardik was named Team India captain in the two-match T20I series against Ireland, which India won 2-0.

290.title: How many times did Manmohan ji attend all-party meet?: BJP to Congress
290.article_body: Reacting to the criticism of Congress party over PM Narendra Modi's absence in the all-party meet held today, BJP's Pralhad Joshi said that before 2014 no PM used to attend all-party meet. "Congress's Jairam Ramesh raised issue that PM didn't attend the meeting today...How many times did Manmohan Singh ji attend the all-party meeting?" the Union Parliamentary Affairs Minister asked.

291.title: Delhi govt’s power subsidy is 'propaganda': Gautam Gambhir
291.article_body: East Delhi MP Gautam Gambhir said claims of power subsidy by the Delhi government are an eyewash as it comes from taxes paid by the people. "In the past eight years, people of Delhi have just been at the receiving end of propaganda and hogwash," Gambhir said. He added that private electricity companies collect around ₹20,000 crore every year.

292.title: Fire at Rajasthan vegetable market, dozen shops gutted; no casualties
292.article_body: A major fire broke out at a vegetable market in Rajasthan's Dholpur district on Saturday night. Reports said that a dozen shops were gutted in the fire. Several fire tenders reportedly reached the spot. However, the cause of the fire is yet to be ascertained. No casualties were reported in the incident.

293.title: CrPC Section 144 imposed in Kallakurichi after violence over girl's suicide
293.article_body: Prohibitory orders under CrPC Section 144 have been imposed in Tamil Nadu's Kallakurichi, Chinnasalem and Nainarpalayam taluka as violence broke out after a Class 12 girl died by suicide. In a note, the girl alleged that two teachers were torturing her. The School Education Department has asked Kallakurichi's Chief Education Officer to submit a detailed report on the incident.

294.title: Achieved it using our vaccines: VK Paul on crossing 200 cr COVID vaccination mark
294.article_body: As India crossed 200 crore COVID-19 vaccination mark, Niti Aayog’s Dr VK Paul said it's a magnificent milestone for the country. "We've achieved this using our own vaccines. All the credit for this achievement goes to people and leadership of the country," he added. Union Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya said, “India has set...new record by completing target…in just 18 months."

295.title: I've been blocked from visiting Singapore to present Delhi Model: CM Kejriwal to PM
295.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal has written to PM Narendra Modi saying he's been "blocked" from visiting Singapore to present the 'Delhi Model' of governance before world leaders. The Lieutenant Governor reportedly hasn't responded to the visit request sent on June 7. Kejriwal said he's been invited by the Singapore government, adding, "[it's] a matter of pride for [India]...Kindly grant permission."

296.title: Delhi Police uses Kareena's K3G character Poo to stop traffic violations
296.article_body: The official Twitter handle of Delhi Police used actress Kareena Kapoor's character Poo from 2001 film 'Kabhi Khushi Kabhie Gham' to prevent people from jumping red lights. The video shows Poo as a red light saying her famous dialogue, "Kaun hai yeh, jisne dobara mudkar mujhe nahi dekha (Who is this, who didn't turn around to see me again)?"

297.title: Nadal, who pulled out of Wimbledon, set to resume training from Monday
297.article_body: Rafael Nadal is reportedly set to resume training from Monday in order to participate in the Canadian Open, which will begin on August 5 in Montreal. Nadal had pulled out of Wimbledon ahead of his semi-final due to an abdominal tear. "Nadal really wants to come to Montreal and his hotel rooms are already booked," said tournament director Eugene Lapierre.

298.title: Sindhu's coach responds to trolls saying she won Singapore Open as top players didn't play
298.article_body: PV Sindhu's coach Park Tae-sang took to Instagram to respond to trolls saying she won Singapore Open because top rankers didn't participate in the tournament. "That doesn't mean Sindhu's win is anything but light, Light to shine It doesn't matter who participates, who doesn't," he wrote. "Who can despise this win for her like that?" he further wrote.

299.title: 11 SEBI officials' email accounts hacked & used to send 34 emails, FIR filed
299.article_body: Mumbai police has filed an FIR after the Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) approached them, alleging the email accounts of its 11 officials had been hacked and used to send as many as 34 emails by unknown persons. "It was a small incident. CERT-IN is fully in the loop. No sensitive data was lost," the markets regulator said.

300.title: I was told 'Be calculative; post more about work, less about parties': Janhvi
300.article_body: Actress Janhvi Kapoor revealed in an interview that she has been told being calculative and maintaining a certain image is necessary to succeed in Bollywood. The actress further said that she was also told to put more content on social media about work so it doesn't seem like she is "only doing yoga and partying and eating food".

301.title: Stunning performance: Anurag Thakur on Sindhu's 1st Singapore Open title
301.article_body: Sports Minister Anurag Thakur took to Twitter to praise PV Sindhu following her title win at Singapore Open on Sunday. "Stunning performance by Sindhu to clinch her first ever Singapore Open title...third title of 2022, she is looking in superb form!" Third seeded Sindhu defeated Wang Zhi Yi of China 21-9, 11-21, 21-15 in 58 minutes.

302.title: Fire breaks out in Pune's Hadapsar, 12 huts gutted; no casualties
302.article_body: Twelve huts were gutted in a fire that broke out in Pune's Hadapsar area in early hours of Sunday. Reports said that no casualties were reported in the incident. Fire brigade officials said that the control room received a call about the fire at 2:55 am. The fire was brought under control.

303.title: Haridwar schools to remain closed from July 20-26 amid Kanwar Yatra
303.article_body: The District Magistrate in Uttarakhand's Haridwar on Sunday announced a holiday for all schools and Anganwadi centres from July 20 to 26 due to the increasing number of devotees and the possibility of the closure of roads for the movement. The annual pilgrimage of Lord Shiva devotees began on July 14. It is taking place after two years.

304.title: Story of Bajrangi Bhaijaan 2 takes a 10-year leap: Vijayendra Prasad
304.article_body: Writer Vijayendra Prasad said the sequel to Salman Khan-starrer 'Bajrangi Bhaijaan' will be a continuation of the first part. "The story takes an eight to 10-year leap in 'Bajrangi Bhaijaan 2'. I'm hopeful...the sequel will be no lesser than the first part," he added. In an earlier interview, Kabir Khan said Salman chose 'Pawan Putra Bhaijaan' as the sequel's title.

305.title: Delhi man who killed family, self, lost crores in IPL betting: Police
305.article_body: Days after a 40-year-old man allegedly shot himself dead after killing his wife and two daughters over losses in his jeans business in Delhi, police found that the man was also debt-ridden. The man had lost crores of rupees after betting on Indian Premier League (IPL) cricket matches. The deceased had also sold some of his properties, police said.

306.title: India announce their playing XI for ODI series decider against England
306.article_body: Team India captain Rohit Sharma won the toss and elected to bowl first against England in the ODI series decider in Manchester. India have made one change to their playing XI, with Jasprit Bumrah being replaced by Mohammed Siraj. Rohit revealed during the toss that Bumrah is missing out from the match due to a back spasm.

307.title: India's 16-yr-old Praggnanandhaa wins Paracin Open chess title in Serbia
307.article_body: Indian Grandmaster R Praggnanandhaa won Paracin Open 'A' chess tournament in Serbia on Saturday, scoring eight points from nine rounds. The 16-year-old remained unbeaten and finished half a point ahead of top seed Alexandr Predke, who finished at second spot with 7.5 points. Praggnanandhaa drew the seventh round with Predke and the ninth and final round with Kazakhstan's Alisher Suleymenov.

308.title: NSA invoked against Prayagraj violence accused Javed Mohammad
308.article_body: The district administration in Uttar Pradesh's Prayagraj has invoked the National Security Act (NSA) against Javed Mohammad, one of the main accused in the June 10 violence in the city. The violence broke out during protests over suspended BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma's remarks against Prophet Muhammad. Javed, who is a businessman, is currently lodged at the Deoria district jail.

309.title: Govt breaking hopes of crores of families by making youths unemployed: Rahul
309.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi criticised the BJP by tweeting a video of the SSC GD 2018 candidates protesting against the delay in their recruitment by marching for 800 kilometres before police stopped them in Agra. "People will be arrested for demanding their rights in 'New India'...Government is breaking the hopes of crores of families by making youths unemployed," Rahul tweeted.

310.title: PM absent during all-party meet, isn’t this 'unparliamentary'?: Cong's Jairam
310.article_body: As the government held an all-party meeting on Sunday, Congress' Jairam Ramesh said, “The PM was as usual absent”. “Isn’t this unparliamentary?” he tweeted. “Today in the all-party meeting many political parties...pointed out the contradiction in the [PM] Modi Sarkar claiming credit for its Presidential candidate...and killing off the Forest Rights Act, 2006 on the other hand!” he added.

311.title: Violence worries me, accused will be punished: TN CM on Kallakurichi violence
311.article_body: Reacting to the violent incidents which broke out in Tamil Nadu's Kallakurichi after a school girl committed suicide alleging torture by teachers, CM MK Stalin said, "Violence worries me." "Accused will be punished when the police probe ends. I have asked DGP, Home Secretary, to travel to Kallakurichi. I request people to maintain peace," he added.

312.title: She wasn't my mother's friend, gossip was spread by vested interests: Lalit Modi on Minal
312.article_body: Former IPL Chairman Lalit Modi, in an Instagram post, clarified that his late wife Minal Modi wasn't his mother's friend. "Departed love of my life Minal was my best friend for 12 years while she was married. She wasn't my mother's friend. That gossip was spread by vested interests," he wrote. Minal was nine years elder to Lalit.

313.title: Which household items will get costlier from tomorrow due to changes in GST rules?
313.article_body: Pre-packaged and labelled food items like curd, lassi and buttermilk will get costlier from July 18 as they'll attract 5% GST. Jaggery, khandsari sugar, puffed rice will no longer be exempt from GST. Kitchen utensils like knives, spoons, forks, and stationery items like pencil sharpeners, maps, globes and electrical appliances such as LED lights and fixtures will also get costlier.

314.title: FBI 'most wanted' drug lord with $20 mn reward on him captured, pic released
314.article_body: Infamous drug lord Rafael Caro Quintero, a leader in the Guadalajara cartel, has been captured after being traced by a search dog in Mexico. Quintero was added to the FBI's 10 'most wanted' criminals list in 2018 and a $20 million reward was announced for his capture. He allegedly terrorised and destabilised Mexico during his time in the cartel.

315.title: Ali Abbas Zafar to direct Hindi remake of 'The Transporter': Report
315.article_body: Filmmaker Ali Abbas Zafar will reportedly be directing the official Hindi remake of the 2002 Hollywood film 'The Transporter'. A source revealed that producer Vishal Rana has bought the rights of the Jason Statham-starrer from international studio EuropaCorp. "Vishal...approached Ali...who was...happy to come on board, not just as a director but also as a co-producer," the source added.

316.title: Violent protests outside TN school after student's suicide, school property burnt
316.article_body: Violent protests broke out in front of a school in Tamil Nadu's Kallakurichi district where a student had died by suicide, alleging torture by teachers. In a video shared by Times Now, the protestors can be seen trying to overturn a bus while school property can be seen burning. The student had named some teachers in her suicide note.

317.title: Ileana D'Cruz dating Katrina Kaif's brother Sebastien: Reports
317.article_body: Actress Ileana D'Cruz is in a relationship with UK-based model and Katrina Kaif's brother Sebastien Laurent Michel, according to reports. Sebastien and Ileana have reportedly been dating for about six months now. They both also went to attend Katrina's birthday celebration in Maldives, with Ileana sharing a picture with Sebastien, Katrina and Vicky Kaushal among others.

318.title: Babar breaks Kohli's record, becomes fastest Asian batter to reach 10,000 int'l runs
318.article_body: Pakistan captain Babar Azam on Sunday became the fastest Asian batter to reach 10,000 runs in international cricket, breaking Virat Kohli's record. The 27-year-old reached the 10,000-run mark during Pakistan's first innings in the first Test against Sri Lanka. Babar took 228 innings to reach the milestone. Kohli had set the previous record by taking 232 innings.

319.title: Dhoni trusted me to win games when I was 22, it was massive: Lungi Ngidi
319.article_body: South Africa pacer Lungi Ngidi has said it was "massive" for him when MS Dhoni backed him during his IPL debut in 2018 for CSK. "Having someone of Dhoni's calibre put his trust in me to win him games when I was 22 was massive," he stated. Ngidi further said that IPL taught him how to handle a "big crowd".

320.title: Club mistakenly delivers Chicken Curry to vegetarian family in MP; fined ₹20,000
320.article_body: A fine of ₹20,000 was imposed on the restaurant of Madhya Pradesh's Jiwaji Club after it mistakenly delivered Chicken Curry to a vegetarian family who had placed an order for Matar Paneer online. The complainant, who is a member of the Jiwaji Club, alleged that he took the matter to the consumer forum as the club took no action.

321.title: To accuse Patel 20 months after his death is part of vendetta: Chidambaram
321.article_body: Reacting to accusations of conspiracy over the 2002 Gujarat riots against late Congress leader Ahmed Patel, party leader P Chidambaram said that to accuse Patel of conspiracy, 20 months after his death, is a "part of a vendetta" against a political opponent. "To allege that Ahmed Patel acted at the instance of Sonia Gandhi is vile and vengeful," Chidambaram tweeted.

322.title: It's true 'Rocky...' is delayed, still have song to shoot: Karan Johar
322.article_body: Karan Johar has confirmed the reports that 'Rocky Aur Rani Ki Prem Kahani' has been delayed. "It's true we're delayed. I...have a song to shoot. We were meant to shoot it this month...there were location issues in Europe," he stated. Karan added, "Now, Alia (due to her pregnancy) won't be able to shoot until February 2023. We'll shoot...after her delivery."

323.title: Urdu is not a religion specific language: TRS' KT Rama Rao
323.article_body: TRS Working President KT Rama Rao said that Urdu is not a religion specific language but regretfully some ignorants are trying to give such an impression. He further criticised BJP government and said that on one hand Centre is releasing funds for promotion of Urdu and on the other hand BJP leaders are indulging in misleading propaganda against the language.

324.title: Air India Express flight to Dubai diverted to Muscat due to burning smell in cabin
324.article_body: An Air India Express flight travelling from Calicut to Dubai on Saturday was diverted to Muscat as a burning smell was detected from the cabin mid-air. As per the Directorate General of Civil Aviation officials, the burning smell was coming from one of the vents in the forward galley. They added that the DGCA is investigating the incident.

325.title: Akshay & Emraan-starrer 'Selfiee' to release on Feb 24, 2023
325.article_body: Akshay Kumar and Emraan Hashmi-starrer 'Selfiee' will receive a theatrical release on February 24, 2023. The film is an official remake of the 2019 Malayalam film 'Driving Licence', which featured Prithviraj Sukumaran and Suraj Venjaramoodu. 'Selfiee' also features Diana Penty and Nushrratt Bharuccha. Akshay and Emraan will be sharing screen space in a film for the first time.

326.title: Bus collides with truck in UP's Rampur; 6 dead, 21 injured
326.article_body: A bus collided head-on with a truck in Uttar Pradesh's Rampur district. Six people died on the spot, out of which four have been identified as Shamimul Haq (35), Naseem Khan (52), Abdul Wahid (50) and Sakshi (26), police said. Notably, 21 others are seriously injured and have been admitted to the district hospital, police added.

327.title: A fighter to the core: Mahindra praises PV Sindhu after she wins Singapore Open
327.article_body: Businessman Anand Mahindra took to Twitter to praise PV Sindhu after she won the Singapore Open. Sharing a tweet by Doordarshan Sports which had an old image of Sindhu, Mahindra wrote, "That’s not just her facial expression, but the expression of her soul. A fighter to the core...Never getting demoralised by a slump. Teaching us how to rise again."

328.title: My mindset is the same in ODIs like it is in T20Is: Suryakumar Yadav
328.article_body: India's Suryakumar Yadav has said he tries to play his natural game irrespective of the format. "My mindset is the same in ODIs, I try to bat similar to how I do in T20Is...Even if the wickets are falling, I try to keep the scoreboard ticking," he stated. India will play the third and final ODI against England on Sunday.

329.title: India creates history again: PM Modi on crossing 200 cr COVID vaccination mark
329.article_body: As India crossed 200 crore COVID-19 vaccination mark, Prime Minister Narendra Modi said that India has created history again. "Congrats to all Indians on crossing special figure of 200 crore vaccine doses. Proud of those who contributed to making India's vaccination drive unparalleled in scale and speed. This has strengthened global fight against COVID-19," a tweet by Prime Minister read.

330.title: Violence erupts after meat pieces thrown inside a temple in UP
330.article_body: Violence erupted in Uttar Pradesh's Kannauj district after some unidentified miscreants allegedly threw pieces of meat in the compound of a village temple. Idols were also allegedly desecrated at two places, which led to protests during which several shops were set on fire, police said. DM Rakesh Mishra said two FIRs had been registered in connection with the incidents.

331.title: Only 10% of Delhi's population got booster doses: CM Kejriwal
331.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal urged people to get booster doses amid rising concerns over fresh surge in COVID-19 cases and said that only 10% of Delhi's population have got it so far. "I appeal to all eligible citizens to take 'precaution dose' of COVID vaccine, provided for free in Delhi. It will also be administered at mohalla clinics," he said.

332.title: Hold discussions on issues in interest of country: LS Speaker to leaders
332.article_body: Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla on Saturday appealed to leaders of all political parties to hold discussions on key issues in the interest of the country. "The monsoon session will begin on 18th July and it will conclude on 12th August," Birla added. The Lok Sabha Speaker chaired the meeting of leaders of all political parties on Saturday.

333.title: How a startup should operate: Mahindra on old video of Man City's 44-pass goal
333.article_body: Businessman Anand Mahindra took to Twitter to share a 2018 video of Manchester City's 44-pass goal against Manchester United and wrote, "A lesson in teamwork...But also an analogy for how a startup...needs to operate." He further said that success comes from going "back and forth, trying new angles of approach and going for the kill when strategic path is clear".

334.title: Growth of franchise cricket is impacting international calendar: PCB
334.article_body: Ahead of the announcement of the next cycle of the Future Tours Programme (FTP), the Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) said it has asked the ICC to devise a way to regulate the growing T20 leagues. "The growth of franchise cricket is impacting the already-crammed international cricket calendar...[we're] concerned about this development," PCB chief executive Faisal Hasnain said in a statement.

335.title: 3-year-old girl falls into toilet pit, dies in Pune village
335.article_body: A three-year-old girl fell into a toilet pit and died in Pune's Koregaon Khurd village. The deceased, Gatha Nitin Kaduskar, was playing near a pit construction site, which was filled with rainwater due to incessant rainfall, locals said. Villagers rescued the girl after finding her toys near the pit but later, she was pronounced dead at the hospital.

336.title: Mumbai Police arrest 28-yr-old man for sexually assaulting teenager last yr
336.article_body: A man was arrested for allegedly sexually assaulting a 14-year-old boy in Mumbai's Mulund in July 2021. The accused, Sunil Badarage (28), went absconding after allegedly assaulting the victim in a public bathroom, police said. Notably, a similar offence in another case has also been registered against Badarage at the Shrinagar Police Station in Thane, police added.

337.title: 7 held in Delhi for cheating people on pretext of redeeming credit card points
337.article_body: Seven people were arrested by the Delhi Police for allegedly defrauding people on the pretext of either redeeming credit card points or increasing credit card limit. An accused, Pulkit (23), disclosed that he runs a call centre with three women for this purpose from his home, police said. The other accused are Rahul (22), Avinash (37) and Jitender (28).

338.title: 6 of top 10 most valued firms lost ₹1.68 lakh crore in m-cap last week
338.article_body: Among the 10 most valued firms, six companies suffered a combined loss of ₹1.68 lakh crore in their market valuation last week. While TCS took the biggest hit as its market valuation declined by ₹99,270.07 crore to reach ₹10,95,355.32 crore, it was followed by Infosys, whose valuation dropped by ₹35,133.64 crore to ₹6,01,900.14 crore.

339.title: Presidential poll isn't a contest between 2 individuals but ideologies: Sinha
339.article_body: Ahead of the Presidential election, Opposition’s Presidential candidate Yashwant Sinha said this year the Presidential election is not a contest between two individuals but two ideologies. "Only one side wants to protect the provisions and values enshrined in our Constitution. I appeal to all MPs and MLAs to vote according to the Constitution and their conscience this time," he added.

340.title: Kashmiri Pandits welcome Hajj pilgrims with aarti in Srinagar, video surfaces
340.article_body: Dozens of Kashmiri Pandits welcomed the first batch of Hajj pilgrims with 'aarti' at the Srinagar airport on their return from Saudi Arabia, reports said. A video of incident was shared by Free Press Journal. 145 pilgrims were received by the local pandits with 'aarti' which was accompanied by 'Naat' (Praises of Prophet of Islam) at the airport on Saturday.

341.title: Awesomely outrageous roller-coaster: 'Doctor Strange' director on RRR
341.article_body: Hollywood filmmaker Scott Derrickson, known for directing the 2016 film 'Doctor Strange', has said that he "loved" SS Rajamouli's 'RRR'. Taking to Twitter, he wrote, "To celebrate my birthday last night, my wife, kids and I watched 'RRR', what an awesomely outrageous roller-coaster of a movie. Loved it." The film also featured Ram Charan and Jr NTR.

342.title: Shamshera made for masses, this was something forgotten in B'wood: Sanjay
342.article_body: Actor Sanjay Dutt has said that his upcoming film 'Shamshera' is made for the masses. "'Shamshera' is an amazing film, the most commercial film I have come across in recent times...This is the kind of work I've done all my life, but it got somewhere forgotten in Bollywood," he added. The film also features Ranbir Kapoor and Vaani Kapoor.

343.title: Mumbai civic body converting asphalt roads into concrete to fix pothole problem
343.article_body: The Mumbai civic body, Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC), has launched a mission to convert the asphalt roads in the city into cement-concrete (CC) ones in a move to rid them of potholes. Of the 2,055 km road network in Mumbai, the BMC has already converted more than 50% of asphalt roads into cement concrete ones, a senior official said.

344.title: India crosses 2 billion COVID-19 vaccination mark
344.article_body: More than 2 billion doses of COVID-19 vaccination have been administered in India, 18 months after vaccinations began in the country on 16 January 2021. According to CoWIN data, this includes 1,01,90,73,891 first vaccination doses and 92,59,26,880 second vaccination doses. As many as 5,50,14,860 precaution doses have also been administered.

345.title: Factory manager rapes 15-yr-old employee with wife's help, makes her drink acid in Delhi
345.article_body: A 31-year-old manager of a factory allegedly raped a 15-year-old girl who worked under him in Delhi, following which Delhi Commission for Women issued a notice to Delhi Police. The accused allegedly raped her with his wife's help, police said. The girl's father said the accused forcibly made her drink acid days after the crime.

346.title: It is not a sacrifice at all: Bill Gates on plan to give away all his wealth
346.article_body: Microsoft Co-founder Bill Gates, who plans to give away all his wealth, said, "My giving this money is not a sacrifice at all." He added, "I feel privileged to be involved in tackling these great challenges...and I believe I have an obligation to return my resources to society." Gates is currently the world's fourth richest person with $113 billion wealth.

347.title: BCCI had ₹40 cr in bank when I joined & ₹47,680 cr when I was banned: Lalit
347.article_body: In an Instagram post, Lalit Modi asserted that he neither took any government favour nor any bribes from anyone. He added, “I was born with a diamond spoon...When I joined BCCI, it had ₹40 crore in the bank. I joined on my birthday on November 29, 2005. Guess what was in the bank when I was banned - ₹47,680 crore."

348.title: PV Sindhu beats China's Wang Zhi Yi to win Singapore Open, bags her 3rd title of 2022
348.article_body: PV Sindhu on Sunday won the Singapore Open title after defeating China's Wang Zhi Yi 21-9, 11-21, 21-15 in the final. It is Sindhu's third title victory of the year. The 27-year-old became the second Indian woman badminton player to win Singapore Open. Saina Nehwal had become the first Indian woman shuttler to win Singapore Open in 2010.

349.title: I hold nothing against anyone: Lungi Ngidi on De Kock not taking a knee
349.article_body: Talking about his teammate Quinton de Kock's decision to not take a knee during the 2021 T20 World Cup, South Africa pacer Lungi Ngidi said, "I hold nothing against anyone." Ngidi added, "Everyone in the team has their own personal reasons...[and] the guys who made that decision [of not taking the knee] had given us their reasons."

350.title: Lalit shares pics with PM Modi & others amid trolling, says 'was born with diamond spoon'
350.article_body: While criticising people trolling him over his relationship with Sushmita Sen, Lalit Modi shared old pictures with PM Narendra Modi, Amit Shah, UK Prince Charles, Dalai Lama, Nelson Mandela among other personalities. He said he doesn't care about people calling him a fugitive, adding, "I was born with a 'diamond spoon'. I didn't take a bribe or ever needed to."

351.title: Our focus is to bring India to world through our stories: Joe Russo
