351.article_body: Director Joe Russo has said that India has a "strong and fantastic film business" just like the US. "It's sadly not broken through on an international level consistently," he added. Joe further said that it is his and his brother Anthony Russo's "special focus" to bring some of the Indian talent and India to the world through their stories.

352.title: Is word ‘revari’ unparliamentary, asks Akhilesh Yadav
352.article_body: SP chief Akhilesh Yadav on Saturday asked, "Is the word ‘revari’ unparliamentary?" His statement came as PM Narendra Modi, after inaugurating Bundelkhand Expressway in UP, cautioned people against "revari (sweet) culture". "If those in power, running the ‘thank you’ campaign after distribution of 'revaris', could focus on giving jobs to youth, they could avoid 'culture of blaming'," Yadav tweeted.

353.title: With Eng ODI series on line, I don't think India will make many changes: Vaughan
353.article_body: Ex-England captain Michael Vaughan has said he won't be surprised if India go with the same side in the ODI series decider against England on Sunday. "Old Trafford is not that place where it swings...You have to hit the pitch hard. I don't think India will make many changes," he stated. India had lost the second ODI by 100 runs.

354.title: Rainfall lashes several parts of Delhi, minimum temperature drops to 26.4°C
354.article_body: Rain lashed several parts of Delhi on Saturday, causing temperature to decrease. Reports said Safdarjung station recorded a maximum temperature of 36.5 degrees Celsius, while the minimum was 28.3 degrees Celsius. Meanwhile, at Lodhi Road, minimum temperature dropped to 26.4 degrees Celsius. Maximum on Friday was 38.5 degrees Celsius, reports added. Rainfall was also witnessed in city on Sunday.

355.title: Karnataka will be malaria-free by 2025: State Health Minister
355.article_body: Karnataka Health Minister K Sudhakar said that the central government has given a target of eradicating malaria by 2030 but the state government has taken it as a challenge to make the state malaria-free by 2025. The government requires the support of non-governmental organisations and the public in addition to government programmes to fulfil this motive, he said.

356.title: You all call me fugitive, which court has ever convicted me: Lalit Modi
356.article_body: Lalit Modi on Sunday took to Instagram to speak about various issues after he revealed his relationship with Sushmita Sen. He wrote, "[Though you all] call me a "fugitive"...tell me which court has ever convicted me...None…Everyone knows how difficult it is to do business in India." Speaking about IPL, he said, “Everyone...knows that I did it all alone"

357.title: Instead of post-retirement ambitions, judges should serve nation: Gehlot
357.article_body: Judges and bureaucrats should work to serve the country rather than be concerned about their post-retirement ambitions, Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot said on Saturday. He added that if someone becomes an MLA, a CM, an MP or a judge, then he gets a chance to serve the country and should be proud of doing it.

358.title: Lalit Modi reacts to 'trolling' over relation with Sushmita, calls media 'obsessed'
358.article_body: Reacting to being trolled for tagging a wrong account while confirming his relationship with Sushmita sen, Lalit Modi said, "Why is the media so obsessed about trolling me?" "I guess we are still living in the Middle Ages that two people can't be friends & then if chemistry is right & timing is good- Magic can happen," he added.

359.title: Man starts thinking of having kids when he's nearing 40: Ranbir
359.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor, speaking about the thought of having children, said, "This...happens when a man is nearing 40." He added, "You start thinking these things also, that 'when my child will be 20, I will be 60. Will I be able to play any sports, do things, go on any trek?'" Ranbir's wife Alia Bhatt announced her pregnancy in June.

360.title: IndiGo not following maintenance procedures, technicians tell Airbus; airline replies
360.article_body: IndiGo's technicians have written a letter to aircraft manufacturer Airbus complaining that the airline is not following standard maintenance procedures leading to risking passengers' safety. They said the technical staff has been on a strike for a couple of days and the airline is operating flights without proper maintenance. Meanwhile, IndiGo denied the allegations, calling them "baseless".

361.title: Man rescued from B'luru tracks just before train arrives, video surfaces
361.article_body: The Ministry of Railways has shared a video of Railway Police Force personnel rescuing a man from railway tracks in Bengaluru's KR Puram Railway Station. In the video, the man can be seen stuck on the track. A police personnel can be seen running towards him and rescuing him just seconds before the train crosses the track.

362.title: Horseman dies while saving Amarnath pilgrim from falling down a cliff
362.article_body: A 22-year-old Kashmiri horseman died while trying to save an Amarnath pilgrim from falling down a cliff. As per the horseman Imtiyaz's relatives, he was walking his horse when he realised that the pilgrim was sleeping and seemed to be falling over. Imtiyaz rushed to wake the pilgrim up during which he lost his balance and fell down, they said.

363.title: How is Dhankhar 'Kisan Putra', when he was sleeping during farmers' protests: TMC
363.article_body: Soon after BJP announced West Bengal Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar as NDA's Vice Presidential candidate and called him a "Kisan Putra" (son of a farmer), TMC said Dhankhar was sleeping during farmers' agitation. "Those who just tweet on issues...cannot be for people. When there was farmers’ agitation, Dhankhar was sleeping, how can he be Krishi Putra," TMC MP Santanu Sen said.

364.title: Don't want statue in Rashtrapati Bhavan, we're electing President: Tejashwi
364.article_body: RJD's Tejashwi Yadav on Saturday said, "We don't want any statue in Rashtrapati Bhavan, we're electing President." Furthermore, he said, "You must have...heard [of] Yashwant Sinha but we have never heard of the Presidential candidate of the ruling party. She hasn't held a single press conference since she became a candidate." Earlier, NDA announced Droupadi Murmu as its Presidential candidate.

365.title: 7-time Olympic gold medallist Felix ends career with 19th World C'hips medal
365.article_body: American athlete Allyson Felix ended her career with a 19th World Championships medal as the US team won bronze in the 4x400m mixed relay in the ongoing World Athletics Championships. Felix won 11 Olympic medals, including seven gold medals, in her career. She won silver in the 200m in the Athens Olympics at the age of 18.

366.title: On what criteria BJP chose Dhankhar as Vice Presidential candidate?: TMC MP
366.article_body: TMC MP Saugata Roy asked, "On what criteria did BJP choose West Bengal Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar as their candidate for Vice Presidential election?" Furthermore, he said, "Everyone thought that a minority candidate would be chosen for the Vice Presidential election by BJP but the party made it clear once and for all that they are not interested in the same."

367.title: Who are the highest-paid FMCG CEOs in India in FY22?
367.article_body: Marico’s MD and CEO Saugata Gupta emerged as the highest-paid FMCG CEO as his total pay in FY22 jumped by 157% from ₹14.03 crore in FY21 to ₹36.1 crore in FY22. Gupta is followed by HUL's Sanjiv Mehta at ₹22 crore salary, Nestle's Suresh Narayanan (₹18.80 crore), Dabur India's Mohit Malhotra (₹14.60 crore) and ITC's Sanjiv Puri (₹12.59 crore).

368.title: 2 men arrested for reciting Hanuman Chalisa in UP's Lulu mall amid namaz controversy
368.article_body: Police in Uttar Pradesh's Lucknow arrested two persons and detained a few others for reciting Hanuman Chalisa inside the newly opened Lulu mall. This comes after controversy over a viral video of a group of people offering namaz inside the mall. Earlier, the mall authorities had put up a sign, stating religious prayers were not allowed inside the mall.

369.title: Not delusional, got attention because of who my parents are: Janhvi
369.article_body: Actress Janhvi Kapoor has said she knows that the attention and recognition that has come her way is because of who her parents are. Janhvi, who is the daughter of producer Boney Kapoor and late actress Sridevi, added, "There's a lot of clarity...I'm not delusional and thinking that I've earned all of it or I deserve any of it even."

370.title: India records 20,528 new COVID-19 cases; list of state-wise active cases released
370.article_body: India has reported 20,528 COVID-19 cases and 49 related deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. The list released by the ministry shows West Bengal has the highest active COVID-19 cases at 30,613. This is followed by 24,645 active cases in Kerala, 17,228 in Tamil Nadu and 15,521 in Maharashtra.

371.title: Akshay & Suniel's 'Mohra' was a risky film with new faces: Director
371.article_body: Filmmaker Rajiv Rai said his 1994 film 'Mohra' was a risky film with new faces. "I thought Suniel Shetty...Akshay Kumar fit the part," he further added. Rajiv revealed late actress Divya Bharti, who he introduced in Bollywood with the film 'Vishwatma', was keen on doing the film. However, Raveena Tandon signed the film after things with Divya didn't work out.

372.title: India ranks 24th at International Mathematical Olympiad, wins 6 medals
372.article_body: India ranked 24th out of 104 countries at International Mathematical Olympiad held in Norway from July 6 to July 16, 2022. The team has won one gold and five bronze medals. Pranjal Srivastava from Bengaluru has scored hat-trick with his third consecutive gold medal at IMOs and is the only Indian to have won three golds at the event.

373.title: Who would've thought Indian-origin man could be UK PM: Zerodha Co-founder on Rishi Sunak
373.article_body: Zerodha Co-founder Nikhil Kamath took to Twitter to share a picture with the UK's former Finance Minister Rishi Sunak, who is one of the contenders for the post of UK Prime Minister. "Who would have thought 75 years ago on August 15, 1947, an Indian origin man could be the Prime Minister of Britain one day," Kamath wrote on Twitter.

374.title: 1st prototype train of Mumbai Metro 3 expected to arrive in Aug: MMRC chief
374.article_body: The trial run of underground Metro 3 (Colaba-Bandra-SEEPZ) will begin soon with the arrival of the prototype rake in August, Mumbai Metro Rail Corporation Limited's (MMRCL) MD Ashwini Bhide said. The trial run would be conducted inside the 3-km underground Marol-Maroshi station, and a temporary parking set-up nearby, she said. The prototype rake will cover 2,000 kilometres during trial run.

375.title: 3 arrested in Delhi for running extortion racket with China-based gang
375.article_body: Three people were arrested by the Delhi Police for allegedly working with a China-based gang to extort money on the pretext of short-term loans. The suspects are identified as Ravi Pankaj (28), Javed Ansari (30) and Vikas Yadav (19). Notably, last month, a complainant alleged that she was threatened by agents despite returning the loan amount on time, police said.

376.title: Jagdeep Dhankhar’s image is of Guv who rules hearts of people: Nadda
376.article_body: West Bengal Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar’s image has been of a Governor who rules the hearts of the people, BJP chief JP Nadda said. His statement came as he announced that Dhankhar is NDA’s candidate for the post of the Vice President of India. "Shri Dhankhar Ji is the son of a simple farmer family," Nadda added.

377.title: 20-yr-old Pune man steals vehicles to take girlfriend for joyrides, held
377.article_body: The Pimpri-Chinchwad Police have arrested a 20-year-old man for allegedly stealing motorcycles and four-wheelers for taking his girlfriend for joyrides. The accused has been identified as Yash Kiran Solse. The police have recovered 13 motorcycles and two four-wheelers worth ₹3,45,000 from the accused. The incident came to light after police found him during night patrolling.

378.title: Withdraw GST on healthcare services: IMA writes letter to Finance Minister
378.article_body: The Indian Medical Association (IMA) has written a letter to Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman requesting to exempt healthcare services from GST. Citing various recommendations by the 47th GST Council on certain facilities that were earlier exempted from GST and will be taxed post-July 18, IMA said the cost "will add a significant additional cost to the healthcare of people."

379.title: IndiGo flight to Hyderabad lands in Pakistan after pilot finds defect in plane
379.article_body: IndiGo's Sharjah-Hyderabad flight was diverted to Pakistan's Karachi after the pilot observed technical defect in the aircraft, which is being examined at the airport, the airlines said. "An additional flight is being sent to Karachi to fly the passengers to Hyderabad," it added. This comes days after Delhi-Dubai flight made an emergency landing in Karachi after developing a technical fault.

380.title: Rohit has shown a lot of confidence in me, I'd like to pay back: Suryakumar
380.article_body: India batter Suryakumar Yadav said captain Rohit Sharma has helped him a lot with his batting since his domestic cricket days. "Rohit has shown a lot of confidence in me...[and] the way things are going, I would like to pay back that confidence by scoring runs," he stated. Suryakumar slammed a century in the third T20I against England.

381.title: Unknown miscreants open fire at lorry driver in Hyderabad's ORR area
381.article_body: Some unknown miscreants opened fire at a lorry driver, who was carrying iron and steel, in the Outer Ring Road (ORR) area of Hyderabad. The driver Manoj Yadav was coming from Telangana's Chandapur and going towards Kochi in Kerala. In the incident, the front cabin glass of the lorry was damaged, however, the driver did not sustain any bullet injury.

382.title: Bride, family take boats as heavy rains flood roads in Andhra; pics go viral
382.article_body: A bride and her family took boats to the groom's house amid flooded roads due to heavy rainfall in Andhra Pradesh's Konaseema district. Videos and pictures of the wedding party are going viral on social media. The State Disaster Response Force mobilised a team to help them with the boats and reach the venue, according to reports.

383.title: Murali Sreeshankar finishes 7th in 1st men's long jump final for India at World C'hips
383.article_body: Long jumper Murali Sreeshankar finished seventh in the first-ever men's long jump final for India in the World Athletics Championships history. The 23-year-old registered a best jump of 7.96m to finish seventh. China's Jianan Wang won gold medal with a best jump of 8.36m, while Miltiadis Tentoglou of Greece won silver medal with an 8.32m jump.

384.title: Industry makes you stone, drills into you to seek your benefit: Neetu
384.article_body: Actress Neetu Chandra, speaking about the film industry, has said, "This industry makes you a stone; it drills into you to only seek your own benefit." She added there were times when she felt unwanted despite "doing so much". Neetu further stated, "I always say physical strength leads to mental strength and good mental health...it's...important to speak about mental health."

385.title: Badrinath-Rishikesh National Highway closed due to heavy landslide in U'khand
385.article_body: The Badrinath-Rishikesh National Highway near Khankra in Uttarakhand has been closed due to a heavy landslide in the area, news agency ANI reported. Earlier, the national highway to Badrinath had been closed due to landslides at Kuchda Nullah. Meanwhile, the Badrinath Highway had also been blocked recently due to falling boulders after overnight rainfall in the area.

386.title: Video of bridge painted like chess board in TN surfaces, Twitter users react
386.article_body: Chennai's iconic Napier bridge has been painted in white and black checks to appear like a chess board, ahead of the Chess Olympiad 2022, which will begin on July 28. Tamil Nadu government official and IAS officer Supriya Sahu shared a video of the bridge. Many Twitter users talked about potential accidents on the bridge due to the 'visual illusion'.

387.title: Cong shifts 5 of its Goa MLAs to Chennai ahead of Presidential polls
387.article_body: The Goa Congress has shifted five of its eleven MLAs to Chennai for the weekend ahead of the Presidential elections on July 18. MLAs Sankalp Amonkar, Yuri Alemao, Altone D'Costa, Rodolfo Fernandes and Carlos Alvares Ferreira were moved to Chennai on Friday evening. On Friday, state Congress President Amit Patkar accused the BJP of trying to lure Congress legislators.

388.title: Free education, healthcare are for making India number 1: Kejriwal
388.article_body: Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal on Saturday said his government's programmes of free education, electricity and healthcare were not "freebies" but were part of his plans to make India the world's number one country. His remarks came as earlier in the day Prime Minister Narendra Modi warned the people against the "revadi culture" of offering freebies in exchange for votes.

389.title: Kohli to take break from cricket, to stay in London after England series: Reports
389.article_body: Ex-Team India captain Virat Kohli will take a break from cricket and will stay back in London after the conclusion of the ongoing series against England, as per reports. Kohli will completely avoid cricket and will be joined by his mother and extended family during the break, reports added. Kohli hasn't been included in India's squad for West Indies tour.

390.title: 31 killed, 39 injured in ethnic clashes in Sudan
390.article_body: At least 31 people were killed and 39 others were injured in tribal clashes in a southern province of Sudan on Saturday. The Hausa and Birta ethnic groups fought over the killing of a farmer earlier this week and the violence continued despite deployment of troops. Sudan has been marred by ethnic clashes since last year's military coup.

391.title: Coronavirus lockdown extended in China's Macao
391.article_body: China's gambling enclave Macao extended its COVID-19 lockdown by another five days on Saturday as it battles one of the biggest virus outbreaks in two years. Now industries and commercial companies will remain closed until July 23 and all dine-in services have been suspended. Macao has reported around 1,700 infections since June 18 and is in lockdown since July 11.

392.title: He has to fight with himself and get things in order: Kapil Dev on Kohli
392.article_body: Commenting on Virat Kohli's poor form, Kapil Dev said a great player like him shouldn't take so much time to get back in form. "He has to fight with himself...get things in order," he added. Kapil further said Kohli might have been dropped or rested from T20I series against West Indies but there's a lot of cricket left in him.

393.title: New pic taken by world's most powerful telescope shows Jupiter with its rings & Moons
393.article_body: NASA has released an image of Jupiter taken from the James Webb Space Telescope, the world's most powerful space telescope. The image by the Webb Space Telescope shows the distinct ring around the planet and some of its Moons. The telescope captured the image using its Near Infrared Camera (NIRCam) filter.

394.title: A good man exits: Jairam Ramesh on outgoing VP Venkaiah Naidu
394.article_body: After BJP announced Jagdeep Dhankhar as NDA's candidate for Vice Presidential election, Congress General Secretary Jairam Ramesh said outgoing VP Venkaiah Naidu's humour and wit will be missed. "On many occasions [Naidu] got the Opposition all agitated...but at the end of it a good man exits," Ramesh said, adding, "He may have retired, but I know he'll not be tired."

395.title: Dhankhar's experience would be of great value for RS: Jaishankar
395.article_body: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar congratulated Jagdeep Dhankhar on Saturday after the latter was nominated as NDA's candidate for the Vice President of India's post. The minister wrote on Twitter, "His great erudition and rich experience would be of immense value for the functioning of the Rajya Sabha." Dhankhar is the current Governor of West Bengal.

396.title: Islam in China must be Chinese in orientation: Prez Xi
396.article_body: During his visit to Xinjiang this week, China's President Xi Jinping asked officials to step up efforts to uphold the principle that Islam in China must be Chinese in orientation. Religions in China should adapt to the socialist society being pursued by the government, he said. Notably, China is accused of carrying out a crackdown on Uighur Muslims in Xinjiang.

397.title: Pic of Christopher Nolan's hand-drawn plot for his film 'Inception' goes viral
397.article_body: A post showing the hand-drawn plot map of the Hollywood movie 'Inception' has gone viral on Twitter. The tweet by Julian Shapiro shows a paper depicting director Christopher Nolan's scribbling about the film's plot in detail. The plot map has been taken from the book 'The Nolan Variations: The Movies, Mysteries, and Marvels of Christopher Nolan' written by Tom Shone.

398.title: Kohli didn't make 70 hundreds in his aunt's courtyard or on Candy Crush: Shoaib Akhtar
398.article_body: Former Pakistan fast bowler Shoaib Akhtar has said that he is defending Virat Kohli over his poor form as he has scored 70 hundreds in international cricket. "Kohli didn't make 70 hundreds in his aunt's courtyard or while playing Candy Crush," he added. Akhtar further said, "All the criticism that is directed at him is designed to make him stronger."

399.title: Russia orders its forces to step up operations in Ukraine
399.article_body: Russia's Defence Ministry on Saturday said that the Russian forces have been ordered to step up operations in Ukraine. The order aims to prevent Ukraine from launching strikes on Ukrainian areas under the Russian control, it added. Notably, the order comes amid the latest series of bombardments by Russian forces across Ukraine.

400.title: Shardul could come in India's squad: Jaffer ahead of 3rd ODI vs England
400.article_body: Wasim Jaffer said all-rounder Shardul Thakur could come in India's squad for third ODI against England at Old Trafford. "When Mohammad Shami comes in at eight, that means the tail is rather lengthy. India have Ravindra Jadeja and Hardik Pandya, so he [Shardul] could be the sixth bowling option as well," he added. Third ODI will be played on Sunday.
